This role is a key to delivering world class digital marketing for our brands across South Pacific. The role primarily focuses on Martech and Consumer data, but also has a BI component. The person we are looking for will have broad experience in all aspects of Digital Marketing and a good understanding of how a data driven approach benefits brands.
  This is a hands-on role working with our business, bottling partners, agencies, technology vendors and global teams across varying projects locally, regionally and globally. The role is perfect for a self-motivated technology thought leader who is looking for a challenging and rewarding career in a company that offers global exposure and career opportunities.
 The key Leadership areas for this role cover: 
Technology Expertise 
Provide Technical and functional expertise to the Business Unit in relation to the technologies supporting marketing and business intelligence. This includes having and maintaining hands on understanding of the systems and being able to train and mentor users in these systems. 
Marketing, Consumer Data & Analytics Strategy and Execution 
Working with the Business and other leaders to help define and execute the Digital Marketing and Consumer Data Strategy. This strategy needs to be aligned to the South Pacific Business and the overall APAC Group and Corporate Strategies. 
Marketing and BI Capability Building 
Work with business to understand what current capabilities need to be enhanced and what capabilities will be required in the future to meet business needs. This will require a good understanding of trends within the markets and also what is happening globally. Understanding of the global business priorities / direction for technology will be an important focus area. 
Agile Project Delivery 
Provide project management and governance to deliver solutions and enhancements to current and future technology platforms. This may be marketing or BI projects that are technical and\or functional. Agile methodologies including providing the role of SCRUM master if required. These projects will often involve team members across the globe so being outcome focussed and results orientated is a must. 
Business Partnering \ Thought Leadership 
Working with the business to bring the best outcomes by providing expertise in areas such as; Digital Media Buying, Consumer Engagement, Campaign Analysis, Consumer Digital Journey and Transactional Marketing Techniques. Leverage the broader company knowledge and experiences by building a robust network of peers will be key to this. 
Data Security 
Provide expertise on data security requirements for managing consumer data within the business unit. Working closely with Marketing and Legal to make sure the business unit is meeting all legal and legislative requirements for the protection of consumer data. 
System Administration & Operational Support 
Work with our various support teams regionally and globally to administer and provide operational support for marketing and BI systems. This includes change, incident and problem management processes. 
Qualifications & Experience required: 
Degree in Information Technology (Marketing) 
5+ Years’ experience in similar role. 
3+ years working in Consumer Goods or similar industry 
5+ years experience in project management and business analysis 
Technically expertise in Data Management, Cloud Storage and BI Platforms, Specifically in: 
Azure Data Lake 
Google Analytics 
Microsoft Power BI 
3rd Party Consumer Data Platforms (Adobe, Salesforce, UM) 
IoT platforms specifically in connected packaging 
Technically expertise in Advertising Technology Platforms, specifically in: 
Web; Adobe ADM, Target 
DMP; Adobe, Salesforce 
Social Monitoring (Sprinklr, Net) 
Ad Platforms; Google, Facebook, WeChat 
Digital Asset Management; Sitecore Stylelabs 
 
  Attributes: 
Constructively discontent – a strong growth mindset. 
External Focus – Looks both internally and externally for new opportunities. 
Self Learner – Always striving to understand 
Self-starter who is proactive and self-motivated, can be relied upon to take the initiative. 
Strong interpersonal skills – able to build successful and constructive business relationships. 
Comfortable in taking calculated risks in the interest of gaining and sharing relevant learnings. 
Humanistic & encouraging nature – willing to learn, share, support other team members and not be ‘perfectionistic’. 
Achievement oriented and results driven. 
Commercially minded – Understand P&L. 
Resilience: (i.e. able to stay the course & make things happen). 
 
Our Growth Culture: 
One of the reasons our company continues to thrive after 130+ years is having a company culture that supports and rewards behaviors that lead to growth. Our “Growth Behaviors,” as we call them, are ways of being and working that help to make us successful. Think about how you can bring this to life in your next role at Coca-Cola. 
 
Curious 
Keep seeking, never settle. Staying curious about what is outside, and two steps ahead inspires us to challenge the status quo. Having the courage to look and leap is the way we grow. Because asking “what if?” pushes us to the next level as people and as a company.
 
 Empowered 
Make it happen .  True empowerment is the result of taking responsibility. This means giving yourself permission to see it, say it and do it, and owning the outcomes. Because we move forward faster when we all take action. 
 
Version 1.0, 2.0, 3.0 
Push for progress, not perfection. There are very few overnight successes. Greatness is borne of many little victories (and failures). Share v 1.0, test it, and make it better. Then create the next version. Because the moment we think something is perfect, it will be obsolete. 
 
Inclusive 
Include, value and trust each other. We are smart alone but together we are genius. This means being inclusive, giving the benefit of the doubt and being responsible for each other. Because, for our company to thrive for the next 100+ years, smart isn’t enough. We need genius.

 Roles and duties include: 
 
 The ICT Business Analyst will be responsible for defining improvements to business processes, gathering information and analysing the client organization’s business intentions, services, processes and information needs to identify changes that lead to business improvements. 
 Analysing business processes and advising customers (potential or existing) on business process automation and optimization. 
 Identifying and communicating with clients to formulate strategies and produce a requirements specification to create system and software solutions for businesses. 
 Analysing existing systems, application design and functions to ensure strategic ICT objectives are met by adopting contemporary analysis best-practice methodologies and processes including performing gap analysis within a scaled agile framework. 
 Working with clients and users to formulate and document business requirements for workplace systems efficiency. 
 Assisting company to develop functional standards for other system users. 
 Provides and designs, based on pre-defined solution architecture, an integrated high-level solution that fit customer’s business & operational needs. 
 Determining any inefficient business practices and system errors, such as duplicate orders, and double payments, etc, and providing efficient optimal business practice, solutions, and system functionality and behaviours 
 Identifying, investigating, and analysing business processes, procedures and work practices to identify and evaluate inefficiencies, thereby recommending optimal business practices to improve business functionality. 
 Manages the overall IT program scope, maintain its continuous alignment with strategic business objectives and works directly with the customer to clearly articulate and document the business requirements. 
 Taking responsibility for deploying functional solutions, such as creating, adopting and implementing system test plans, which ensure acceptable quality and integrity of the workplace systems. 
 Creating user and training documentation, and conducting formal training classes. 
 
 
Skills and experience 
 
 
 Analysing and documenting business and technical requirements that best reflect customer needs; Translating the requirements into prioritize epics/features, supporting the release and iteration planning. 
 Developing functional specifications for use by software engineers and developer programmers to create solutions then creating user and training documentation, and conducting formal training classes to train the employees on the new procedures. 
 Using data and process modelling techniques to create clear system specifications for the design and development of system software. 
 Demonstrating experience as an ICT Business Analyst within an agile environment understanding the business and IT requirements of the client. 
 Acting as a central reference and information source, providing guidance and assistance in the system project decision making process by continuous communications with the client and passing on the information and requirements to the system developers. 
 Establish collaborative and influential relationships with stakeholders, customers and colleagues, to ensure easy and effective achievement of team / project / business goals. 
 Overall accountability and responsibility for scope, time, cost, quality, change and integrations within the project. 
 Effectively participates in and/or leads formal and informal reviews with stakeholders, applying knowledge and experience and providing technical perspective and support; Performs demonstrations of solutions to users. 
 Accountable and responsible for development teams during the iterations (provide business clarifications, adjustment to risks, change in scope, reprioritize and approve “done” stories and features during demos). 
 Responsible for communicating the solution to customers’ business and/ or IT personnel, explaining the details of new solutions and their impact on business processes and ensuring that the customer understands the solution. 
 Follows up on solution design issues in his/her domain until solution is signed off and supports the resolution of configuration/ implementation-related issues if and when they arise. 
 Responsible for solution-related documents and functional specifications; May also configure the solution, and create, execute and maintain test plans when applicable. 
 
 The successful candidate will have a relevant bachelor degree or higher and at least 10 years of relevant experience. It is preferable if you are a permanent resident or citizen of Australia when applying.

Company Description 
Who we are 
At Leidos Australia, our aim is to make the world a safer, healthier and more efficient place, but we won’t get far using existing ideas. We need incisive minds like yours to weave together information technology, engineering and science skills into practical solutions for the most complex and high risk challenges. 
It’s work that matters, and a mission we are passionate about. As a large scale prime systems and services integrator, Leidos turns complex data into practical, usable solutions for our customers. In practical terms, we are Australia’s largest commercial supplier of intelligence services to the Australian Intelligence Community. We maintain legislative websites for governments, provide critical systems integration projects to the Department of Defence and support the IT environment for the Australian Taxation Office. 
No matter who you are or where you work, Leidos has made it a key business goal to ensure everyone feels welcome, valued, respected and supported. It’s about understanding and recognising that everyone is unique and central to building a great place to work. 
We’re passionate about the fact that our work is not just interesting and challenging, but benefits Australia as a country. Innovation is a key value and central to the ethos, and change is constant. So there’s plenty of scope to think differently, develop and learn in an environment that’s both supportive and constantly evolving. 
At the end of the 12 month program, Leidos graduates transition into roles across the company based on their strengths & aspirations and the needs of the business. 
 
 Job Description 
Your Graduate role 
An average week for a Graduate Proposal Analyst could include a wide range of activities, including: 
Contributing to the development, planning and scheduling of proposals 
Collaborating with the team to consider cost, schedule and technical elements in line with proposal specifications 
Liaising with functional departments and attending meetings to collect and understand information relating to cost, scheduling and performance 
Using your research and analysis skills to understand data, and assist with the development of cost models to support proposals 
Graduates will be supported to develop their skills and knowledge specific to this role, to ensure they are able to contribute and reach their highest potential. 
 
 Qualifications 
About you and what you’ll bring 
This role is ideal for someone who is completing or has recently completed a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent intensive course in the following disciplines: 
Bachelor Commerce, Business, Finance, Law, Economics 
And ideal for someone who has: 
Realised they thrive in complex project environments 
Some previous experience engaging with multiple stakeholder and client groups 
Along with your education and any practical experience, Leidos values individuals who use their initiative and seek to understand the business and develop relationships based on respect. 
 
 What you’ll enjoy… 
As a Leidos graduate, you will be working on interesting and challenging projects and will take part in a range of training and development opportunities. To support you further throughout the 12 month program and your early career here at Leidos, you will also be assigned a mentor and buddy. 
Additional Information 
Successful candidates will be required to be Australian Citizens and be able to obtain and maintain an Australian Government Security Clearance. 
At Leidos you’ll enjoy 12 weeks’ paid parental leave as a primary carer, flexible work practices, discounted health insurance, novated leasing and more. Foster your career through complete access to learning and development and mentoring opportunities, we have a strong track record of internal promotion and career transitions.

Atlassian is continuing to hire for all open roles with all interviewing and on-boarding done virtually due to COVID-19. Everyone new to the team, along with our current staff, will temporarily work from home until it is safe to return to our offices. 
 
Do you get excited by the challenge of scaling a fast-growing company through strong analytics and business insight? Using your technical creativity and skills, you will investigate challenges and decision points Atlassian has in scaling its solutions to 100 million users. We’re growing quickly, so you'll need to be a fast learner of new approaches and technologies. You'll be an excellent fit for this role if you have a strong business sense, are an effective communicator and influencer and possess excellent analytic capabilities. 
 
In this role, you are the customer champion, a trusted partner with Product & Engineering teams and an advisor to our Support Operations teams helping scale the business through customer success. You'll be part analyst, part scale product manager, and part program manager. It's both strategic and tactical. It's both relationship and data-driven. 
 What you will do: 
Develop strong partnerships with leaders across the business to align strategy and tactics of product and operations 
Ensure that Atlassian can continue to grow and evolve while delivering legendary support to our customers 
Dig beyond the data to provide actionable recommendations that help improve the customer and product experience 
Build, negotiate, and handle complex initiatives to prevent or eliminate friction in our products and services 
Collaborate with product and support leaders to ensure support engineers are prepared for product change and measure its success 
Act as the customer and support advocate in a highly agile software development environment 
 Required skills: 
Minimum 5 years of relevant experience with at least 2-3 years of experience as an analyst in software development, service delivery, or customer support 
Strong business acumen and ability to map business challenges to source data 
Advanced SQL knowledge and experience 
Excellent written, verbal communication and presentation skills 
Great attention to detail 
Unwavering curiosity and desire to share meaningful insights to improve the customer experience 
Resilient and adaptive approach to manage challenge and seize opportunity 
Strong sense of curiosity, humour, and empathy 
 More about our team: 
This team exists within our Customer Success and Support Organisation and works alongside Product Managers and Development Managers during product planning rollout to prevent friction and prepare customer facing teams to give the best support experience possible. It is important that our team can communicate and advocate for the customer to the internal Atlassian teams. 
 More about our benefits 
 
Whether you work in an office or a distributed team, Atlassian is highly collaborative and yes, fun! To support you at work (and play) we offer some fantastic perks: ample time off to relax and recharge, flexible working options, five paid volunteer days a year for your favourite cause, an annual allowance to support your learning & growth, unique ShipIt days, a company paid trip after five years and lots more. 
 
More about Atlassian 
 
Creating software that empowers everyone from small startups to the who’s who of tech is why we’re here. We build tools like Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, and Trello to help teams across the world become more nimble, creative, and aligned—collaboration is the heart of every product we dream of at Atlassian. From Amsterdam and Austin, to Sydney and San Francisco, we’re looking for people who want to write the future and who believe that we can accomplish so much more together than apart. At Atlassian, we’re committed to an environment where everyone has the autonomy and freedom to thrive, as well as the support of like-minded colleagues who are motivated by a common goal to: Unleash the potential of every team. 
 
Additional Information 
 
We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. 
 
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

 The opportunity 
 
 EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific, with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors. 
 
We implement information-driven strategies and systems that help grow, optimize and protect client organizations. We go beyond strategy and provide end to end implementation of real life data environments and have some of the best architects, project managers, business analysts, data scientists, big data engineers, developers and consultants in the region. 
 
We are looking for a Lead Business Analyst within the DnA team in our Sydney office who believe in getting into the details, understanding technical complexities and asks the right questions to course correct for ongoing delivery and execution. This role is offered on a flexible full time basis. 
 
Your key responsibilities 
 
 Plan, develop, and lead business analysis activities to support project outcomes on large transformation initiatives, following Agile methodology. 
 
 This includes: 
 Gather and analyse complex information for business cases / proposed projects, to determine how best to evolve client capabilities and technologies and improve business performance
 Lead a team of Analysts, assign work effectively and position them for success. Be well versed in business analysis and the technical complexities of the client landscape to be able to ask the right questions and guide the team to meet outcomes, goals and priorities of the client 
Run client workshops with the Product Owner and Scrum team to gather requirements, refine and write user stories and support the agile delivery of features E2E across dependent technology and business teams 
Influence how requirements are elicited; what documentation will be produced; and how it will be signed-off and transitioned to other project resources like Development and Quality Assurance/User Acceptance Testing. Lead requirements elicitation, documentation and review activities
 Manage multiple inflight features at various stages of refinement and delivery cycle
 Collaborate confidently with a range of both technical and non-technical stakeholders across multiple levels, managing both internal and external stakeholders’ expectations
 Understand the overall scope of the project and be able to identify when requirements are changing and ensure that project change management procedures are being used properly 
Confidently create and present complex and technical information in a structured manner
 Work fluently in both technical and business environments with a strong domain focus on cloud platforms, DW / BI Reporting and Analytics 
 Skills and attributes for success 
 Demonstrated experience as a Lead or Advanced Business Analyst, with the ability to synthesise complex concepts into succinct means, drawing business insights and communicating these effectively
 Structured and analytical thinker 
Demonstrated ability to engage and influence Senior stakeholders including C-level executives, while leading business analysts and other team resources 
Strong verbal and written communications skills 
Strong Microsoft Suite skills (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Visio) required 
Strong presentation skills and the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross functional audiences 
Ability to work effectively with EY and client teams to identify, document and drive an outcome from idea to execution 
Exposure to end-to-end project delivery, either traditional SDLC or agile delivery methodologies (or hybrid approaches)
 Deep management consulting and/or agile program delivery experience preferred
 Experience in Cloud Platforms, Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence and Analytics projects preferred 
 Ideally, you’ll also have 
 Experience in Banking and Financial Services 
Strong consulting experience and background 
 
 Who are Advisory? 
 
Our Advisory service line focuses on helping clients to improve their performance and manage their risks more effectively. From an improved finance function, enhanced supply chain, or superior customer experience, EY teams are able to offer added value and turn our client’s strategy into reality! This is why Advisory is the fastest-growing service line and an energetic, fast-paced environment. Learn more about Advisory here.

We’re seeking out a driven Business Analyst to play a key role in our fast-paced digital product development team! We’re not going to lie - it’s not an easy gig - there is a huge amount of responsibility and impact for this role - but for the right candidate, it will be the best role you’ve ever had! ;)
 
The software we build (and there is a lot!) is used by millions of customers, so this role has a huge impact. The team you will be a key member of is fast-paced, independent, ambitious and proficient across the full tech stack. They’ll challenge your assumptions and proposed solutions, and push you to better solve problems or define solutions.
 
If you’re looking for a regular 9-5 office job then we’re not for you. We’re looking for ambitious people prepared to do whatever is required to get the right solution live for our customers and built efficiently - advocating for the best customer experience on Kogan.com.
 
 In order to join the team, you’ll be: 
 
 A problem solver with an analytical mindset, even better, if you have experience with business, data, customer (or even financial-type) analysis! We are looking for exceptional logic and analytical skills over limiting our reach to people only in software development. 
 Someone with excellent communication skills, ideally experienced in ‘managing’ stakeholders, project management and gathering requirements from the business to achieve the desired outcome(s). You’ll both learn about, present and optimise business goals to our tech team in order for the right technology to be built, efficiently. 
 Someone with great attention to detail, whilst being able to manage multiple priorities and lots of context switching - you will thrive on knowing everything from the broader business objective(s) to the edge cases. 
 Experience with software development is a plus, but if you do, we want you to care about the full SDLC and not just writing BRD’s! You’ll love working alongside our developers and designers to advocate for the business, customer and technology objectives. 
 Someone who is accountable, organised, upbeat, super motivated and experimental. We want our business analysts to be passionate about building amazing software and technology solutions for our millions of customers - whether that be new functionality on the sites we build and maintain, integrations with third parties or performance optimisations to keep everything running super smoothly for our customers! 
 
 What you’ll do: 
You will be working within our core engineering team to service both our internal stakeholders and most importantly, our customers. To do this, your role on the team will be to:
 
 
 Be the ‘front door’ of our tech team - working with our site and customer data, stakeholders, partners and customers to agree, document and prioritise future and in-flight technology changes. 
 Break down ambitious business goals into smaller technology deliverables that our software engineers can iteratively push through to production; 
 Understand and document acceptance criteria, facilitating scope management, quality and timeliness as a requirement makes it way through the entire software delivery lifecycle; 
 Drive the focus on shipping to production as quickly as possible, using data to identify, escalate and improve delivery bottlenecks to ensure our software delivery lifecycle flows efficiently; and 
 Understand and document estimated and actual business value delivered to provide insights into future improvements. 
 Understand how to organise your workload and break down your time to focus on tasks and get outcomes delivered daily 
 
HOW TO APPLY
 
To apply, please email dev.jobs@kogan.com with a subject line beginning with [BA2020] . (Do not use the application buttons etc on the site hosting the listing, they will not be reviewed!) Tell us about yourself, your relevant experience (CV/process mapping, analysis / projects outcomes/etc) and why you’d like to work with us.
 
Think you’ve got what it takes to be a part of Australia’s e-commerce future?
 
We’re looking forward to meeting you! In the meantime, you can learn more about us on our Developer Blog at
 https://devblog.kogan.com [https://devblog.kogan.com] and our Kogan.com Careers site:
 http://careers.kogan.com [http://careers.kogan.com].

 Business Analyst, Product Owner, Analyst, Systems Analyst, Iteration Manager, Agile, Lean, Design Thinking, Systems Thinking, Scrum, Project Management, PMO, Data, Big Data, Business Intelligence, Data Analyst, Problem Solver, Innovation, Product Management, Process Mapping, User Stories, User Journeys, Customer Experience, User Experience, Strategy

GroupM   Australia 
Overview of job
 
GroupM is the world’s largest media investment company and are a part of WPP. In fact, we are responsible for one in every three ads you see globally.
 We are currently looking for a Business Analyst to join us for a 12 month Maternity Leave contract. In this role, you will work as the product owner for the digital workflow tool used within our business, along with leading a number of business and industry level projects across all media types. This role requires you to build relationships and communicate with all levels of the business and suppliers, managing both internal and external stakeholders. You will work day to day with the business to understand and prioritise the business needs and provide business support. As part of your work across various projects, you will be involved in requirements gathering, user acceptance testing through to documentation and business process and application implementation.
 At GroupM APAC, our people are our strength, which is why fostering a culture of diversity and inclusion is important to us.
 Reporting of the role 
This role reports to the Media Systems Manager. 
 3 best things about the job : 
Working as part of a team driven by an ever changing and fast paced media landscape 
Leading the Australian market’s digital process application within the APAC region
 Interacting with business partners and end-users closely to play an influential role on how technology solutions shape the way their business operates 
 
In this role, your goals will be: 
 In  3  months  you would have : 
 Gained a solid understanding of media processes and systems at GroupM – with a key focus on digital 
Become confident in managing the digital planning and buying system and seen as the expert on the system; answering queries from local agencies and regional teams 
Built relationships with key stakeholders, both internal and external 
Gained an understanding and can follow the business and project process at GroupM including standard documentation 
 
In  6   months  you would have : 
 Led and managed projects autonomously 
Identified and prioritised opportunities for projects and enhancements to new and existing systems/products/processes 
Key contact for all Digital projects 
 In  12  months  you would have: 
Closed off multiple projects successfully with documentation in place 
Completed documentation and updates on any outstanding projects for handover 
 
W hat your day job looks like at GroupM : 
Make yourself breakfast supplied by the company 
Answer user support queries 
Meet with agency staff to understand an issue they have with an existing process. Determine if changes are needed to the process, if additional data needs to be set up in the system to meet their needs or if we need to brief the vendor for development work. 
Help users with application integration issues and set up required data mappings 
Approve new system code requests to ensure they fit in with the data quality structure of the applications we manage 
Chase up for approvals on a range of new processes being implemented
 Update and distribute application usage documentation to reflect a process change 
 
What you’ll bring: 
Essential 
A strong media background with digital media experience
 A positive, solution orientated attitude 
Strong analytical and problem solving skills 
Excellent communication & stakeholder relationship management skills
 Strong sense of accountability with an ability to work to deadlines and manage multiple tasks 
 Highly Regarded 
Skills in business process mapping and requirements gathering with the ability to identify and investigate issues and raise development ideas
 Understanding of user acceptance testing processes and ability to coordinate and conduct testing 
Experience in new business process implementation including documentation and training material preparation 
Prior experience in running end user training
 Ability to question & challenge users at all levels with confidence, to arrive at a clear and unambiguous view of requirements
 Product management and third party software vendor management would be preferable but not required 
 More about  GroupM 
GroupM is the leading global media investment management group serving as the parent to WPP media agencies including Mindshare, MediaCom, Wavemaker, Essence and m/SIX, as well as the programmatic digital media platform, Xaxis, each global operations in their own right with leading market positions. GroupM’s primary purpose is to maximize the performance of WPP’s media agencies by operating as leader and collaborator in trading, content creation, sports, digital, finance, and proprietary tool development. GroupM’s focus is to deliver unrivaled marketplace advantage to its clients, stakeholders and people, and is increasingly working closely for the benefit of clients with WPP’s data investment management group, Kantar. Together, GroupM and Kantar account for over 50% of WPP’s group revenues of more than $20 billion. 
Discover more about GroupM at www.groupm.com 
Follow @GroupMWorldwide on Twitter 
Follow GroupM on LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/company/groupm

GroupM Australia takes pride in being a group built on a set of core values that extend to every aspect of our operation. We are committed to providing an empowering workplace that offers opportunities to learn, succeed and grow. We do this through our dedicated in-house training team who tailor our programs for every level of employee in every discipline across the group. GroupM is the largest media investment management company in Australia with 30% market share and over 800 employees. With such a unique culture, GroupM embraces workplace diversity, allowing our employees to bring different ideas and solutions to the workplace.

Senior Business Analyst 
 
Are you looking for a change in your career? Looking to be apart of our future direction? 
 
Our industry is undergoing an unprecedented transition on a global level. Decarbonisation, decentralisation and digitisation are driving this inevitable shift, with improvements in technology seeing not only changes in how electricity is generated, but also in how it is used. In this environment, it is vital that our business evolves to ensure we deliver our vision of ‘empowering communities to share and use energy for a better tomorrow’. 
 
Customers engage with our business in many ways. With the increase in different technologies and ways of engaging, we need to adapt to ensure we are putting the customer at the core of what we do through personalisation of our services to enhance their engagement with us. We need to evolve our systems, tools and work practices to ensure we are set up for success and can focus on the customer instead of the paperwork. With that in mind, we are seeking two Senior Business Analysts to join the Empowering Customers Workstream team, one at a workstream level and the other for the Customer Contact Centre Optimisation Initiative.

We are seeking individuals who are proactive, have strong commercial awareness and understanding of customer engagement principles. You will have a strong desire to analyse and help solve complex business problems. Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills, as well as extensive knowledge and solid understanding of project management processes and methodologies are key skills required for this role.

Mondelēz International. Make it with us. 
We take pride in making and baking the world's most iconic snacking brands, such as Cadbury, Oreo, Philadelphia, Pascall and The Natural Confectionery Company. 
From innovation and manufacturing, to marketing and selling, everything we do is brought to life by the brightest minds, collaboration and of course, decades of knowledge. 
Globally, we lead the future of snacking and our future has never been brighter, tastier, healthier, sweeter, crunchier or bolder. 
Make it an opportunity. 
We currently have a  12-month contract  opportunity for a data savvy individual to join our procurement team as a  Business Analyst . In this role you will support the Business Unit Procurement Lead through the coordinating, generating and analysing of critical metrics, reports and presentations related to the procurement end to end agenda. If you are a critical thinker who thrives in a fast-paced environment and brings a whole lot of curiosity, we would love to hear from you!
 Make it uniquely yours.
 
In this role, you will: 
 
Develop standard reporting mechanisms on all aspects of procurement, including productivity, service, inflation mitigation, commodity spend, cash, new product development
 Coordinate and publish the monthly scorecard for leads across the business
 Work closely with the Mondelēz Supply Chain (MSC) Finance team to drive planning cycles and conduct monthly reconciliations, bridge analysis and cost evaluation exercises
 Support overall procurement governance for the Business Unit
 
 Make it possible. 
You bring: 
 
The ability to build strong relationships across the business, partnering with a variety of stakeholders
 Strong data analysis skills, with the confidence to drive change
 Comfort when faced with ambiguity, being able to pivot and adapt to a transforming environment
 The ability to transform technical information into actionable commercial insights
 Exceptional communication skills, written and verbal
 A passion for problem solving and process improvement, not being afraid to challenge the status quo
 An understanding of the FMCG environment (advantageous)
 Intermediate skills across the Microsoft Office Suite, with advanced Excel
 Make it together.
 
 Have pride in what you do.  We feel the love when we describe where we work, because our brands are the kind people fall in love with.
 
 Embrace the challenge.  The fast moving and challenging nature of our work presents significant opportunities to learn and grow. Do more, learn more, grow more.
 
 Work together for a better world.  Being truly global is not just about being big, it's about never thinking small and making a positive impact on the world.
 
 Bring your own flavour.  We believe that what makes our workplace great is passion and personality, so we encourage you to be yourself, lean in, speak up, have fun and dare to be different.
 
 Live our values:  Love our consumers and brands | Grow every day | Do what's right
 
 And we support flexibility.  Because we know that work is always better when life is good.

What you’ll do 
 Among Australia’s earliest adopters of the Google platform and agile methodologies, we are continually investing in future-focused IT solutions. We seek curious, innovative and resourceful technology experts to help us pave the way and to make the most valuable impact. 
 
 As a Senior Business Analyst, you will play a critical role in this strategic imperative by liaising with business and technology stakeholders for delivery of business requirements which form the basis of change to business processes, policies or systems, to ensure that the delivered solution for SAP Payroll meets the needs of the business. 
 
 Your background 
 We are so much more than great supermarkets - we are a team of great people connected through our shared values. We are sustainably innovating to meet the ever- evolving needs of our customers. 
 
 As our successful candidate you have strong SAP knowledge and you have extensive Business Analysis experience in an enterprise retail organisation. You have the ability to work cross-functionally with both the technology team and the business in meeting core objectives and you can manage multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment. Exceptional communication, influencing and stakeholder engagement skills along with strong analytical and problem solving skills are essential. 
 
 Above all, we are seeking innovators and thought leaders who will help us bring a little good to everyone, every day. #Work180 
 
 Joining the Group 
 
 As an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do. 
 
 We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation or life stage and we are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTI inclusion. 
 As our Group continues to evolve, innovate and support our communities, we encourage our team members to do the same with their own careers, by providing ongoing opportunities to grow and make a real difference. 
 
 We value flexibility, and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing. 
 
 We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all, and most importantly, we're all about creating better experiences – for our customers and for each other. 
 
 We’d love to hear from You 
 
 If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. This role is also open to applicants who are seeking part-time or flexible working arrangements. 
 
 You can learn more about working with us on LinkedIn or via www.wowcareers.com.au #LI 
 
 Our Talent Acquisition Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. Woolworths Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

The Macquarie Capital business is investing in an exciting digital transformation that will transition all underlying core business technology from in-house systems to industry leading software-as-a-service solutions with a focus on Salesforce as a key pillar. 
This newly created Business Systems Analyst role will be report to the Product Owner for Transaction Management and focused on seeking out, developing and thoroughly defining systems requirements that drive improved efficiency and digitalisation across the entire deal lifecycle. Your day-to-day focus will be to support the Product Owner in analysing the business domain while stocking and grooming the product backlog with the Technology Delivery Team. 
Ideally, you will be a detailed planner and expert communicator who is wholly committed to the discovery and development of robust solutions in an ever-changing digital landscape. 
To be successful, you will need: 
5+ years of proven experience in product requirements analysis and definition 
proven experience working in Agile and Waterfall delivery methodologies 
exceptional analytical abilities, attention to detail and ability to learn new concepts quickly 
practical experience generating process documentation and reports 
excellent communicator with the ability to translate technical details into actionable insights 
proven capabilities in project and user-testing management 
highly proficient technical writing capabilities 
exposure to Salesforce and Investment Banking will be of significant benefit. 
To start your journey with us and work on this exciting digital transformation, apply online today. 
About Macquarie Capital 
Macquarie Capital offers global capability in M&A Advisory, Debt and Equity Capital Markets and Principal Investments underpinned by deep specialist expertise across a range of sectors. Our people are empowered to think innovatively to address client challenges and originate opportunities, thinking beyond individual transactions to become a trusted adviser and partner over the long haul. From origination to execution, our unique combination of ideas, capital and expertise is transforming opportunity into reality for our clients and partners around the world. 
With staff in 29 offices transacting across 19 countries, Macquarie Capital is a truly global business. A role in the team will expose you to a dynamic working environment and the opportunity to contribute to high-profile transactions whilst working in a business with the best people in the industry. 
Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion 
Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team. 
We recognise that flexibility comes in a variety of forms. Talk to us about what flexibility you need.

About the company: Myhealth Medical Group (MyHealth) was founded by Dr James Liang in 2007. Starting from a tiny 120m2 practice at Baulkham Hills, and with no business background, James adopted a very hands on approach to business guided by two main principles. Myhealth is now Australia's fastest growing medical centre group providing an exceptional experience for all patients, doctors and staff. 1. "Kaizen", which is a Japanese word meaning continuous improvement. 2. "Fairness" by providing doctors with best and most flexible working conditions and patients with the highest level, non- discriminatory medical care at the lowest cost. Myhealth struggled initially but quickly flourished under James' two guiding principles over the last 10 years, winning over the hearts and minds of many doctor partners, patients, and shopping centre landlords. Myhealth has grown to over 80 clinics across three eastern states in Australia and is now the largest shopping centre based medical operator in Australia. Myhealth is now servicing more than 1.2 million patients yearly. About the role: Business Analyst Work with Myhealth users to formulate and document business requirements Identify, investigate, and analyses Myhealth's processes, procedures and work practices Identify and evaluate inefficiencies, and recommend optimal business practices, and system functionality and behaviour Use project management methodologies, principles and techniques to develop project plans and to cost, resource and manage projects across Myhealth clinics Take responsibility for deploying functional solutions across Myhealth group Create user and training documentation, and conducting formal training classes for Myhealth staff and customers if necessary Use data and process modelling techniques to create clear system specifications for the design and development of system software Skills required: Bachelors degree / at least 2 years full time work experience in a similar role and health care environment. Salary: $70k - $85k package Job Type: Full-time Salary: $70,000.00 to $85,000.00 /year Experience: healthcare: 1 year (Preferred) Work Eligibility: No work eligibility is required, I am willing to sponsor the right candidate (e.g. visa) (Preferred)

job_title: Senior Business Analyst, MIMA Pricing and Payment
description:
This role is a 12 months fixed term opportunity. 
At Telstra, we believe the more connected people are, the more opportunities they have. That's why we help create a brilliant connected future for everyone, everyday. 
In InfraCo, we lead and drive growth the wholesale market as a strategic partner of NBN, while managing key fixed network assets. 
You will be part of a high performing team delivering against specific targets (internal and external) to support the delivery of NBNCo Multi Technology Mix (MTM) Network via MIMA DPs and will be responsible for the commercial analysis and reconciliations of payment claims and schedules for HDA Delivery to ensure contractual commitments are met. 
In this role you will be responsible for: 
The timely and accurate financial management and accurate processing of payment claims and payment schedules 
Providing NBN™ with the times and amounts for payment to the MIMA delivery partners 
Reviewing and monitoring of payment claims from the MIMA delivery partners 
Managing the calculation of the various components of a work release including the profile payments and margin payments 
Ensuring sample physical audits of the quantities the subject of a payment claim have been carried out as required 
Prioritising and removing roadblocks that may be jeopardising contractual deliverables 
To be successful in this role, you need to have the following: 
Strong Stakeholder Management skills and the ability to work effectively with key internal and external teams 
Previous experience working in a complex contract within a demanding and changing environment 
Expert MS Excel and data mining skills 
A passion for solving complex issues, a self-starter, and a team player 
A job at Telstra is like no other you've had. You'll be challenged, you’ll be inspired, and you'll be proud. Because whatever your job is here, you'll always be part of something bigger. 
 
If you can help us add a positive impact to every Telstra customer’s experience, enjoy collaborating with different people and can handle challenge in any form, we'd love to hear from you. 
 
We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce. To enable everyone to participate, we’ve developed an ‘All Roles Flex’ policy to consider flexible ways of working for every role.

Company Description 
 
Nine’s strategy is to create great content, distribute it broadly and engage audiences and advertisers. 
We are Australia’s largest locally owned media company – the home of Australia’s most trusted and loved brands spanning News, Sport, Lifestyle, and Entertainment, we pride ourselves on creating the best content, accessed by consumers when and how they want. 
Nine’s assets include the Nine Network, major mastheads such as The Sydney Morning Herald, The Age and Australian Financial Review, radio stations 2GB, 3AW, 4BC and 6PR, digital properties such as nine.com.au, 9Now, 9Honey, Pedestrian.TV, subscription video platform Stan and a majority investments in Domain Group and CarAdvice. 
 
 Job Description 
 
Business partnering 
Providing business partnering support to specific business units 
Working collaboratively with the business stakeholders to identify cost saving opportunities and drive improvements 
Liaise with key internal stakeholders across multiple facets of the business 
Assist to drive strategic initiate to ensure revenue / profit growth 
Finance process and results 
Preparation of monthly financials, reporting and analysis as well as other corporate reporting requirements 
Calculate and process end of month accruals and provisions 
Develop & implement financial models 
Process improvement across finance 
Manage the day to day financial activities for your area for example purchase order approvals 
Budgeting and forecasting 
Lead the annual budgeting and forecasting process for your areas 
Performing monthly forecasts 
Develop and maintain appropriate budgeting and forecasting models 
Analysis and insights 
Performance Analysis of periodical results in liaison with key business leaders 
Analysis of financial impacts of changes and improvements to the business 
Provide insight into the business’ financial performance, proactively highlighting gaps 
Ad hoc analysis 
 
 Qualifications 
 
Experience operating as a trusted advisor and valued partner to business leaders 
Excellent financial analysis skills 
Proven experience of successful collaboration between finance and non-finance teams 
Fluency in English 
Professional experience working in a fast moving business environment 
Graduate degree and/or internationally recognised finance/accounting qualification (i.e. CA/CPA) 
At least 5 years experience in Finance and commercial accounting 
 
Core Competencies 
Excellent oral and written communication, collaboration and relationship building skills; ability to quickly form working relationships and gain credibility with senior management 
Strong influencing skills and judgement to get the balance right between challenging business management to ensure achievement of revenue and profit targets and working in partnership with the business 
Ability to challenge existing thinking 
Unafraid to deal with confrontation and confident making decisions under pressure 
Excellent negotiation skills 
Ability to work to challenging deadlines and deliver quality work in demanding fast paced environment 
Ability to juggle multiple priorities to deliver strategic objectives 
Proactive in identifying and solving complex problems/ issues 
Ability to think innovatively in developing and implementing solutions 
Additional Information 
 
All applicants must be eligible to work in Australia permanently. 
 
If you’re looking for your next challenge in a fun, rewarding environment, then this could be the role for you. Our people move fast and act smart: if this sounds like you, then let’s talk! 
Disclaimer: We do not accept unsolicited agency resumes and are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Our client is an Australian Federal Government Department which plays an instrumental role in essential Government services. 
 
Due to on-going and new projects, their Business Solutions and Technology Division are looking for an accomplished ERP Business Analyst to join their Business Solutions team, working closely with ERP and Financial systems implementation groups. This is a 12-month contract based in Canberra with a strong possibility of extension. 
 
You must be an Australian citizen and hold an active Baseline (Federal Government) Security clearance to be considered for this work due to Federal Government access restrictions. Those Business Analysts without an active Baseline clearance will not be considered. 
 
Your responsibilities will include analysis, design and specification of new and existing IT systems in areas such as procurement, accounts payable, travel and enterprise contract management to maximise our client's investment in the financial management information system. Working closely with the Finance Systems team and other business stakeholders, you will ensure whole-of-business outcomes are considered as part of the business requirements gathering and validation process. 
 
Our ideal candidate will have:
 Current Baseline security clearance is essential (AUS citizenship) 
 ERP systems implementation and configuration experience 
 Strong experience in workshop facilitation and presentation skills 
 Proven experience in business analysis, human-centred design and the ability to apply critical thinking to deconstruct problems 
 A demonstrated ability in documenting high-level and detailed requirements 
 Mapping current and future state business processes 
 Proven experience in requirements gathering and developing acceptance criteria and functional specifications with the ability to apply knowledge of business systems and translate business needs into technical requirements 
 Experience in applying business process re-engineering to business and application processes and procedures 
 Experience with TechnologyOne software or other similar ERP systems is desirable, but not essential. 
 
 On offer: 
 Attractive daily rate of up to $800 per day (flexible depending on the BAs experience) 
 Long-term contract with extension options 
 Opportunity to work with cutting-edge ERP software and take a leading role in the delivery of these projects 
 
 If you are an accomplished ERP Systems Business Analyst with an active Baseline Security clearance I would love to speak with you about this opportunity. Apply now for this long-term contract position in Canberra.

Specialists in industry disruption, eWave is an independent digital transformation agency with commerce at its core. Using service design thinking, we have an unwavering commitment to delivering experience-driven digital reinvention that inspires deeper relationships between brands and their customers.
 
Partnering with brands such as Nike, Canon, Coca-Cola Amatil, and Nestle, we work on some of the most exciting and innovative digital projects in the APAC market.
 
Our team is our strongest asset, and together, we're reimagining consumer needs using methods that bring our clients closer to their customers than ever before. We're thinkers, we're creatives, we're technologists, and we're looking for people to join us on our journey.
 
THE ROLE
 
The Digital Delivery Consultant is the subject matter expert on the organisation's eCommerce platforms and technologies, and will translate business requirements from client stakeholders into both functional and technical documentation to be used by the wider Solution Delivery team. In addition the ideal candidate will hav a passion for Project Delivery and as a "Consultant" be willing to combine responsibilities of that of a BA and PM to be able to service our customer base.
 
The ideal candidate will possess strong organisational and problem-solving skills, and a passion for applying their expertise to help companies take the next step in their digital transformation. They would also have a good practical knowledge of the Applications space, with a sound understanding of the SDLC.
 
THE RESPONSIBILITIES
 
Facilitate Discovery Workshops
 Gather & Document Requirements
 Translate Business Requirements into User Stories
 Create Functional & Development Specifications
 Scope & Document System Integrations
 Contribute to Solution Architecture
 Manage the Delivery of Projects
 Analyse Trade-offs between Usability & Performance
 Produce & Prioritise Test Cases
 Conduct Client Training
 Plan & Manage User Acceptance Testing
 Attend Client Meetings
 THE CANDIDATE
 BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience
 3 years of relevant experience, such as technical writing, product documentation, or online publishing including experience with writing technical customer-facing materials
 Previous experience as a Project Manager, Digital Business Analyst, Functional Consultant, Implementation Consultant or Software SME highly advantageous
 (Preferred) 4 years of relevant work experience, including experience researching and writing excellent documentation for developers (APIs, SDKs, web technologies)
 (Preferred) Relevant industry certification
 (Preferred) Ability to manage multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment.
 THE BENEFITS
 Unlimited paid annual leave
 Health & Wellness Initiatives
 Gifted Day of Birthday Leave
 Staff Referral Scheme
 Generous Long Service Gifts
 In-House Cultural Programs
 Lunch Catering
 Continuous Training, Certifications, and Learning Opportunities
 Sponsorship of Attendance at International Events
 
Interviewing Immediately
 Successful candidates will be contacted within 2-3 business days from time of application.
 Please include your CV when submitting your application via LinkedIn

What does a great Senior Business Analyst do?
 The primary role of the Senior Business Analyst is on all aspects of EFT Payments solutions and the primary focus is to work both independently and collaboratively with internal business stakeholders, project and technology teams as well as Clients and Vendor/Partners to ensure timely delivery of various payments technology solutions. 
The Compliance Business Analyst will undertake review of scheme bulletins and regulatory requirements and create Functional Specification to document essential system changes needed to remain compliant. The compliance business analyst will also create implementation Planning and Business Change documentation. 
Position scope includes accurate and timely delivery of project documentation to internal stakeholders and external clients. The role requires working independently with minimal supervision using contractual agreements and company procedures as guidelines. 
The role is client facing and require excellent communication, documentation, planning and coordination skills. 
In addition, you will also: 
Analyse scheme bulletins, regulatory compliance notifications, and document business requirements to ensure core payment platforms remain compliant. This includes working closely with clients and internal/external stakeholders to clearly understand and address business requirements and solutions. 
Produce detailed functional specifications from the business requirements. 
Work with Solution and Enterprise Architects to create, define and assess solution alternatives and strategies in line with Enterprise strategies and Client specific needs. 
Ensures business and system development methodologies are followed and continuously improved. This includes ensuring clients and stakeholders actively participate in appropriate phases of the process, such as requirements gathering and definition and quality review of design documents. 
Facilitate requirement analysis and design workshops. 
Basic qualifications for consideration:
 Tertiary qualifications in Computer Science or equivalent experience 
At least 5-8 years’ experience in the finance industry with at least 4 years’ experience in VisionPlus. 
Previous team leadership experience would be very useful. 
Proven experience in a business analyst position. 
Motivated self-starter, with demonstrated leadership ability or aspiration who is able to generate respect and work effectively within an established team. 
Ability to prioritise and work effectively with minimal supervision. 
Good written and verbal communication skills. 
Demonstrate effective situation management skills when under pressure situations. 
Strong planning and time management skills. 
Attention to detail. 
Quality mindset and a can do attitude. 
Core BA Competencies 
Solid Knowledge and practical application of Business Analysis techniques and good understanding of BABOK. 
A tertiary qualification in Information Technology or equivalent. 
Proven track record of gathering customer requirements, analysing and translating these into solutions, specifications and business processes. 
‘Constant Improvement’ focus – Able to produce ‘lessons learned’ – type documentation to minimise future analysis effort on similar topics and gain overall process efficiencies. 
Payments Domain Knowledge 
Subject Matter Expertise in POS and ATM Driving, Transaction Switching, Card Issuing, Merchant Acquiring, Card Scheme Processing, eCommerce, mCommerce and Payment Gateways 
7 or more years of expertise in working as a Senior Business Analyst or Business Analyst within the payments landscape. 
Experience with one or more products/systems including Connex, Base24, Payment Gateway. 
Experience in Contact (EMV) and Contactless processing as well as EMV Crypto functions.. 
Credit Card Scheme Rules and regulations as well as APCA, CECS and Payment Card Industry (PCI) Data Security Standard compliance. 
Understanding of ISO8583 and AS2805 protocols in regards to Device Operation 
Understand of MasterCard, VISA, UnionPay and other schemes messaging. 
Credit Card Scheme Rules and regulations as well as APCA, CECS and Payment Card Industry (PCI) Data Security Standard compliance. 
International and Domestic (eftpos) Credit Card Scheme Rules and regulations as well as APCA, CECS and Payment Card Industry (PCI) Data Security Standard compliance. 
Hands on compliance project experience 
Cards Lifecycle knowledge would be an added advantage. 
Working experience in transaction switching, Issuing processors or any Core banking systems. 
In depth Knowledge about Schemes from technical, business and operations perspective 
Core Competencies 
Solid knowledge of SDLC and both waterfall and agile methodologies 
Experience in delivering Payments solutions and products 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
Able to produce high quality documentation 
Quality focused with strong attention to detail 
Knowledge of emerging technologies in Payments processing 
Experience in Waterfall and Agile delivery principles 
Ability to demonstrate critical thinking, providing options and recommendations relating to resolving issues, mitigating risks and resolving escalated items 
Proven ability to thrive in a fast paced, dynamic environment 
Self-motivated with ability to work on own initiative 
Flexible 
We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely. 
We're Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. We proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought. 
Learn more about Fiserv: 
Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services”. But we are. 
We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely. 
We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought. 
Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the seventh consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation. 
We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer (Minorities/Females/Vets/Disabled/LGBT)

 The world’s most automated mine thrives on the success of our people, our community, our innovation and our environment. This is where safety is paramount, productivity accelerated and careers are fast tracked. Make your mark at Northparkes while also enjoying awesome lifestyle opportunities in the beautiful Parkes region of Central NSW. 
 Our Business Analyst role:
 This position is within the Financial Management Department and will be a respected business partner to site relied on to develop, lead and complete business analysis functions for the business. 
 Reporting to the Commercial Team, this role will be responsible for development of financial models and business case analysis, cost and production analysis, reporting and business improvement. 
 This residential role is a 12 month fixed term contract opportunity based in Parkes NSW, providing an opportunity to play an interesting role in the Commercial team while going home to enjoy all of the lifestyle benefits the Central West has to offer. 
 Job Requirements
 The successful applicant will possess the 
 following essential criteria: 
 Degree in Commerce, Accounting or Finance 
 Proven diagnostic and problem management skills 
 Analytical skills to interpret financial and operational impacts 
 Ability to work in a team environment 
 Strong communication and leadership skills 
 
 Applications close Friday, 26 July 2019 
 
 If you experience any difficulties with the application process, please advise via email to npm.recruitment@au.cmoc.com 
 Location
 Northparkes Mines - Parkes, NSW 2870 AU (Primary)

 Finance

Who we are
 Babcock International Group has been trusted to deliver bespoke, highly skilled engineering services for over a century, underpinned by a deep understanding of technology integration, unique infrastructure and specialist training. 
Across Australia and New Zealand, Babcock is a key contractor to Defence, emergency services and the oil and gas sectors, employing more than 1000 talented people and we’re growing.
 We focus our specialist skills and knowledge to facilitate clients’ operational requirements, and our expertise across land, marine, aviation and training sectors provides engineering, sustainment and support services that keep the country moving.
 To provide you some local context, here are a few things we do across air, land and sea: 
We’re in the air with emergency services, piloting and crewing air ambulances and search and rescue missions 
We keep things moving on land, with integrated asset management and engineering services for vehicle fleets and infrastructure 
We look after vessels as diverse as naval submarines and luxury yachts, with plenty in between, providing bow-to-stern sustainment and technical engineering support 
About our role – Business Analyst Marine 
Primary focus is to design and implement business, process and technology solutions by determining functional requirements aligned to the Marine strategy. Communication and Integration with internal and external stakeholders to ensure outcomes are delivered. 
The key accountabilities for this position will include but not be limited to: 
Liaise with business managers and employees to analyse, document and improve business processes for change activities 
Facilitate and deliver workflow analysis, process mapping, business requirement gatherings, solution outlines, functional specification to support business needs 
Produce business process updates and training material for change implementations. 
Prepare business cases to support change/improvement initiatives as required 
Strong communication and interpersonal skills 
Understanding of ISO9001 requirements 
About You
 This role will align with a suitably qualified Operations Project Lead that has demonstrable experience in a complex engineering or defence environment. You will be a confident team player and possess exceptional leadership, time management and organisational skills coupled with an ability toprioritise, plan and organise yourworkload with a strong attention to detail. In order to be successful within this position you will require an ability to communicate and foster relationships with all internal and external stakeholders and with teams across all levels of the business.
 Applicants must be eligible for an Australian Defence Security Clearance 
Your future at Babcock – What we offer you 
What sets us apart at Babcock? Babcock offers a supportive and engaging environment where you can drive change and grow your career, we promote and foster training and development and the opportunity to be part of something BIG. Central to Babcock’s core values are health, safety and environment and diversity. If you’d like to be part of an exciting and engaged team, apply via the ‘Apply Now” button below. 
To learn more about us visit www.babcock.com.au

Your Skills & Experience Degree in IT, Computer Science, Engineering or related field. Your experience will come as a pure BA. Navigating complex stakeholder environments in larger / enterprise size businesses. Impressive interpersonal skills to work with and contribute to our clients exemplary reputation with their partners. About You You are ambitious, highly motivated and you bring energy and enthusiasm to a role. Your time management skills are exceptional and you can seamlessly switch between tasks as needs demand. You offer innovative solutions, and have the business insights to know what will work in a commercial environment. What’s on offer? A challenging and rewarding role that will expand your skill set and advance your career. A highly energised workplace where excellence and achievement are rewarded. An innovative and talented team. A company that fosters a flexible workplace and encourages work-life balance. Purpose of role 
The Professional services team is responsible for the delivery of banking solutions to our clients. Delivery includes pre-sales support, gap analysis, project management, branding, development of enhancements and extension. Localisation, integration, quality assurance and deployment. 
As a Business Analyst in the professional services organisation, you will be expected to contribute to all aspects of project delivery with specific focus on the gathering of requirements, both business and technical, to deliver new features and enhancements to existing features on our online, mobile and native app banking. 
Key Relationships 
Reporting to the team lead this position will be part of the project team of developers, business analysts and quality analysts working under the leadership of a project manager and technical lead.

Financial/Banking sector experience is an advantage 
Strong experience in the day to day practicalities of software development lifecycles such as scrum, kanban and waterfall.

Online banking knowledge

Experience integrating to third party vendors 
Experienced in agile BA techniques:

Story mapping

Spikes 
Value stream mapping

 Experienced in agile delivery using scrum and/or kanban; SAFe experience recommended 
Embodies an agile mindset and helps to develop this in others 
Identify stakeholders and develop collaborative working relations 
Lead scrum teams in eliciting and analysing business requirements

Be able to define ‘As Is’ and ‘To Be’ processes

Estimation

Problem-solving 
Planning - sprint level and release level

Collaboration, 
Accountability, 
Analysis & Problem Solving, 
Stakeholder Management,

Influencing & Negotiating, 
Effective communication

Task management and completion

Documentation and knowledge sharing

See yourself being part of a large, transformational change? This could be the role for you! 
 
 Who we are
 At Iress, we believe technology should help people perform better every day. Since our beginning in 1993, people across financial services have trusted us to take their performance to the next level. From the world’s most established financial brands to new and disruptive players, we help improve every aspect of our clients’ businesses so that they can work better, every day.
 Iress is one of Australia’s largest technology companies and employs more than 1,900 people across Australia, United Kingdom, South Africa, Canada, New Zealand and Asia.
 The role
 As a Tehcnical Business Analyst within our Xplan Portfolio Team team, you will play a key part in process improvements and facilitating sessions that are focused around this. This role is for someone who can confidently liaise with software engineers in a product based, technical environment. The Business Analyst is required to clearly document and communicate complex requirements, solutions and processes. You will join a talented, cross functional team where you will bring your BA skills to life.
 What you will be doing

 Develop mock ups and prototypes of proposed Xplan based solutions
 Assist with the documentation of solution requirements
 Ensure team processes are understood and effective
 Ensure JIRA is being used as required and accurately reflects current activity
 Report on configuration, testing and release activity
 Analysis of business process requirements in the context of existing tools and processes, including JIRA
 Ensure customer value is delivered frequently and appropriate measures are in place
 Keep up-to-date with organisational delivery frameworks and approaches
 What you will need
 Excellent verbal and written communicator with some exposure to what it is like to be a Business Analyst
 Industry experience would be highly valued
 Experience in being a Business Analyst in a product based environment
 Confidence in being a technical BA and working with software engineers etc
 Experience in developing mock-ups or other artifacts to help stakeholders understand proposed solutions
 Ability to critically evaluate and improve processes
 Willing to work with others in a collaborative team environment
 Strong initiative to create an environment that fosters initiative in others
 Ability to meet time frames and deadlines
 Not afraid to challenge the status quo
 Why work with us

 State-of-the-art offices

 Global 36-hour hackathon

 Time Type
