Company Description 
 We are an independent technology and management consulting firm dedicated to driving business transformation & innovation for clients on an international level. Our expert solutions focus on Strategy & Change, Information System & Digital, Telecoms, Life Sciences and Engineering. We constantly meet and exceed our 850+ worldwide clients’ expectations – this is made possible by an international team of more than 6,000 people, working together from 80 offices in 55 countries. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. 
 Your Role 
 Reporting to the program’s Lead Business Analyst, this Business/Solution Analyst role will work with cross-functional teams on a range of activities including: data analysis and reporting, implementation of enhancements to core applications and support to the program’s business and technology initiatives. 
 Working with business stakeholders to elicit and define business requirements (data & functionality) and target benefits. 
 Working with software developers and IT specialists to ensure clarity on business requirements and business context as well as defining the solution that will deliver the target benefits. 
 Assisting with the implementation of solutions (business and technology). 
 Assisting with user communications and updates, both written and verbal. 
 Assisting users while embedding solutions in business environment. 
 
 
 About you 
 
 
 Sound analytical and problem solving skills in data and application functionality analysis. 
 Able to work independently and collaborate as part of a team. 
 Excellent communication, both written and verbal. 
 Willingness to learn about solutions from end to end perspective and not just gathering requirements and documentation. 
 Able to work with business stakeholders and IT specialists to define solutions that add most value to the business. 
 Able to drive efforts across multiple teams to meet delivery deadlines. 
 Able to work independently and collaborate as part of a team. 
 Advanced understanding of Excel (formulas, pivot tables, graphs) and comfortable reading and writing basic SQL queries to analyze data and surface insights. 
 Good understanding of technology solutions – client/server, cloud and data-flows/interfaces between integrated systems. 
 Added advantage: qualifications in related disciplines and experience in banking domain. 
 Why us? 
 Be part of an international, multicultural environment of 7,750 talented people over 60 countries and 5 continents
 Join a fast-growing global group with a turnover of €565M and over 1,000 clients across the world 
 Explore opportunities to grow quickly with a tailor-made career path: 70% of our key senior talent joined the company at entry level 
 Take advantage of over 500 training courses in our ACADEMY catalogue, which includes programs in interpersonal communication, team management, project management, etc. 
 Get the opportunity to support nonprofit organizations thanks to our Foundation initiatives and volunteering platform OneSmallStep 
 Depending on your performance and eligibility criteria, you can benefit from international mobility opportunities and progress your career worldwide, and/or experience other departments and sectors 
 Unlock your full potential, both professionally and personally.

job_title: Analyst, Business Information and Analysis, Principal Finance Operations
description:
Supporting the Principal Finance business in Advisory and Capital Solutions, our Operations team is responsible for the middle office management of our global corporate portfolio, from pre-settlement to termination. 
 
Principal Finance provides flexible primary financing solutions and engages in secondary market investing, across the capital structure. Operating globally in both corporate and real estate sectors, the team has experience across a variety of industry groups including real estate, infrastructure, telecommunications, media, entertainment and technology, leisure and healthcare. The team operates globally through offices in Sydney, Singapore, London, New York, San Francisco and Chicago. 
 
This role is an excellent opportunity to join a dynamic and fast paced business to gain global exposure to a range of investing products and structures. This role will see you working directly with senior front office deal teams and other internal functions to ensure the ongoing success of the business. 
 
You will be responsible for management reporting and analysis which includes portfolio and business performance reporting and insight. Further, you will be responsible for managing regulatory capital reporting and treatment oversight. It will also be within your remit to manage business cost reporting and the implementation of cost management processes. 
 
To be considered for this role you will have a tertiary qualification, ideally in Finance or Accounting with an excellent academic record. A post graduate qualification in Finance or Accounting will be advantageous. You will also have 1 – 2 years of experience within Banking or Financial Services in a similar or related role. You will also have proven experience in providing business information, analysis and insight in a highly data driven environment, along with strong Excel and PowerPoint skills. You will demonstrate an ability to work collaboratively in a global team, a strong attention to detail and ability to remain organised in a dynamic environment. 
 
If you feel this position offers you the right career path, then we would like to hear from you. We are seeking a covering letter and concise resume as one Word or PDF-formatted document and a copy of your University academic transcript. To include your covering letter, simply insert an additional page into the front or back of your resume. 
 
About Macquarie Capital
 Macquarie Capital offers global capability in M&A Advisory, Debt and Equity Capital Markets and Principal Investments underpinned by deep specialist expertise across a range of sectors. Our people are empowered to think innovatively to address client challenges and originate opportunities, thinking beyond individual transactions to become a trusted adviser and partner over the long haul. From origination to execution, our unique combination of ideas, capital and expertise is transforming opportunity into reality for our clients and partners around the world. 
 
With staff in 29 offices transacting across 19 countries, Macquarie Capital is a truly global business. A role in the team will expose you to a dynamic working environment and the opportunity to contribute to high-profile transactions whilst working in a business with the best people in the industry. 
 
Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion 
 
Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team. 
 
We recognise that flexibility comes in a variety of forms. Talk to us about what flexibility you need. 
 
 
 About Macquarie 
 The best investment you can make is in yourself. 
 Whether you’re looking to take on a new project; progress within your division; explore an opportunity in a different team; or relocate globally – we let our people decide which direction they want to take.
 At Macquarie we uncover the opportunities others may miss. Our culture promotes innovation, balanced with robust risk management, to realise opportunity for our clients, community, shareholders and our people.
 Macquarie is a diversified global financial group providing clients with asset management, banking, advisory and risk and capital solutions across debt, equity and commodities. Headquartered in Sydney and with offices in 31 markets, it is the breadth of our operations, combined with a strong capital position and risk management framework, that has contributed to our 50-year record of unbroken profitability. 
 
 Job no:  MacCap-952634 
 Work type:  Full time 
 Location:  Sydney 
 Category:  Junior, Accounting & Finance 
 Group:  Macquarie Capital 
 Division:  Advisory & Capital Solutions 
 Recruiter:  Sophie Jones 
 Opening Date:  01/3/2020

Our Purpose is the same today as it was when we were founded 160 years ago, and every day, we work hard to bring our company purpose to life; feeding into the success of our customers and communities and not off it. 
 
We live and breathe our core values of Teamwork, Integrity, Performance, Passion, Leadership and Engagement. 
 
A great opportunity for a Business Analyst to join our Agile squad which is focussed on supporting our Retail Banking platform. The successful candidate will be part of a cross-functional team and will be accountable for supporting business stakeholders by providing relevant and timely insight to enable better decisions, operational efficiency, compliance obligations and business and customer growth outcomes. 
 
 
 The Business Analyst will collaborate with various stakeholders and customer experience solutions owners to elicit and validate needs and requirements for changes to business processes, policies and information systems. 
 
You will be passionate about understanding business problems and identifying opportunities that can be translated into user stories to enable the organisation to achieve its objectives. 
 
 
As the  Business Analyst , you'll: 
 
 Think outside the box and be willing to exchange ideas with peers 
 Work with various stakeholders to understand their business requirements 
 Produce epics, features, and user stories documentation to reflect the business requirements 
 Conduct in-depth analysis and reporting 
 Regularly showcase current solution iterations to stakeholder groups 
 Participate in and support Initiative discovery activities as required 
 Participate & facilitate agile ceremonies and follow the agile principles and practices 
 Work with the squad resources to complete and implement system functionality 
 Identify, investigate and deliver on continuous improvement opportunities 
 
 
As the ideal candidate, you will have: 
 
 Well-developed collaboration, writing and presentation skills using standard industry techniques 
 Extensive Retail Banking solution delivery experience 
 Passion for designing and analysing information 
 Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to build relationships with all levels of the business 
 Innovative approach to and professional focus on the implementation of continuous improvement 
 Have an Agile mindset and value Agile principles and practices 
 Strong knowledge and passion in Banking, Finance or Wealth industry 
 
 
A career with Bendigo and Adelaide Bank will see you become part of the team, your contribution will be valued, and you’ll get all the assistance you need to reach your full potential and achieve your objectives. 
 
 
We also support flexible work arrangements, so talk to us about how this role could be made flexible so you can better balance your individual needs 
 
If you’re excited to be part of an organisation with strong values and a community focus - then this could be the role for you! . To find out more about working at Bendigo and Adelaide Bank or to view other opportunities visit www.bendigoadelaide.com.au/careers

Due to the current health crisis related to COVID-19 and the escalating visa/travel restrictions in place, we're currently unable to extend offers to anyone who cannot work from Australia due to lockdown visa/travel restrictions, or other restrictive measures until further notice. Consequently, we will be prioritizing candidates who can start in this location by set date as expected. We're keeping the situation under review and would adjust our position should the restrictive measures be removed later on. 
Minimum qualifications: 
 
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 
 8 years of experience in investment banking, corporate finance, management consulting or similar field. 
 
Preferred qualifications: 
 
Experience in analytics, spreadsheets, and with SQL.
 Ability to craft and deliver a message with credibility to influence senior leadership.
 Ability to self-direct work in an unstructured environment.
 Robust analytical skills and impeccable business judgment. 
 Excellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skills. 
 About the job 
Financial Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. As a Financial Analyst, your work, whether it's modeling business scenarios or tracking performance metrics, is used by our leaders to make strategic company decisions. While working on multiple projects at a time, you are focused on the details while finding creative ways to solve big picture challenges. 
 
The work of the AUNZ Business Finance team is integral to the operations and strategy of the commercial sales teams. From understanding market and usage trends to exploring the productivity and return of our various investments, the Business Finance organization is an important partner and independent advisor to the commercial leaders in our company. 
 As a Senior Financial Analyst, you will act as a strategic business partner to the AUNZ business and its management team, with a primary focus on advertising sales. You will be responsible for providing deep analytical insight into short term trading as well as working closely with the AUNZ management team to drive longer term commercial insights and plans. You will partner closely with the sales organization and act as a key advisor to the leadership team on issues such as business performance, market investment strategies, resource allocation, and risks/opportunities analysis. 
The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business. 
Responsibilities 
 Provide management with clear insights and recommendations into the business, market trends, risks and opportunities leading to business enhancement and sales actions. 
 Perform deep dive analyses to identify growth drivers to influence business activity. 
 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to structure and execute strategic business initiatives to provide performance and analytical insights. 
 Support critical financial processes such as business forecasting and target setting. 
 At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

As the Business Intelligence Analyst, you will be working on the business’s data warehousing project among a team of Business Analysts and the existing data warehousing division. 
 
In the role, you will be:
 Providing business insights that are not captured in standard reporting/metrics and communicating this message clearly to all interested parties with details on key drivers and recommendations for improvement initiatives 
 Continuously improving the reporting and information suite, through the use of the data warehouse 
 Supporting the larger business function, through the development of data and reporting requirements that align to business priorities 
 Understanding the performance drivers of the business unit and how decisions are made, so that appropriate design and usage of reporting and data can be considered 
 Contributing to the agile project execution 
 Documenting and providing governance over the business definitions, rules terminology and involved metrics 
 Working closely with complex models from varying sources of information, from multiple systems/information sources 
 
 To be successful in this role you will have;
 A minimum of 3 years’ experience working as a Business Analyst in the Financial Services industry 
 Previous data warehousing project experience 
 The ability to summarise large volumes of data and communicate results to business stakeholders effectively, and to also understand overall results at detailed level 
 Thorough understanding of key business drivers and correlation/impact on financial results

Glen Cameron Group IT Business Analyst – Bayswater Location Who we are The Glen Cameron Group, a National multi-site business, is a well-known and respected Transport and Logistics business with over 44 years of success in the industry. About the opportunity This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced and qualified IT Business Analyst to join a leading business with a great organisational culture located in Bayswater. Reporting to the Solution Delivery Manager - Logistics, you will be integral in establishing and improving our Logistics ERP systems. Responsibilities Gathering, analysing and documenting business, functional and technical requirements. Conducting system testing and assisting with user support, training and project delivery. Developing, continuously improving and deploying business solutions and processes using existing and new technologies to enhance business performance. Liaising with all levels of the Business, our Customers and external Suppliers to integrate applications and share information. Working closely with the business and external providers to develop Databases, Reports, Dashboards and Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s) that measure and improve performance. As Australia's largest privately owned IT Services Company conducting business Australia wide and in the Asia Pacific region,  Dialog 's key focus is on delivering outstanding results to its many corporate and government clients using leading tools, technologies and methodologies.  Dialog  is a dynamic organisation which offers attractive career development to its people through diverse projects, training and mentoring in a collaborative atmosphere.

job_title: Senior Business Analyst, STARS Digital Program (Commencing April 2020)
description:
Metro North Hospital and Health Service is the biggest and most diverse Hospital and Health Service in Queensland, delivering the best care by the brightest healthcare professionals.
 Two of our five hospitals – Royal Brisbane and Women's Hospital (RBWH) and The Prince Charles Hospital (TPCH) – are tertiary/quaternary referral hospitals, providing state-wide super specialty services, such as heart and lung transplantation and burns treatment. Redcliffe and Caboolture are major secondary hospitals, and Kilcoy is a regional community hospital.
 This is your opportunity to join the dedicated team of professionals at Metro North Health and be part of a world-class, dynamic and growing health service that embraces technology, excellence in health care, teaching, research and empowering our people to be the best in serving our community.
 About the Role
 
 
 Capture and analyse ‘As-Is' and ‘To-Be' business process models using approved methods and tools. 
 Assess the efficiency and effectiveness of existing business operations and workflow to establish a base for developing improved structures, processes and systems. 
 Develop business and software requirements specifications for IM/ICT projects, ensuring traceability of requirements throughout the project lifecycle. 
 Provide a support and mentoring role for other business analysts within the program/project(s). 
 Contribute to stakeholder engagement, assessment and the development of a stakeholder matrix, and ongoing stakeholder management. 
 Liaise, consult and negotiate effectively with team members, other project teams, agencies and stakeholders, including the coordination of activities associated with achieving the project or team objectives 
 Develop and maintain a Requirements Traceability Matrix and/or Gap Analysis to capture requirements, and to ensure that solutions and test cases are mapped back to the original requirements. 
 
 Job ad reference number:  MN342447 Close date: Monday 20 April 2020
 Find out about the role in more detail and how to apply in the attached Role Description.
 Why work for us?
 We offer rewarding career opportunities across a wide range of clinical and non-clinical areas across our health service and pride ourselves on providing a work environment that is safe, satisfying, flexible, and promotes a healthy work-life balance.
 As a Metro North employee you will benefit from a higher than standard employer contribution to Superannuation of up to 12.75%, access to salary packaging, flexible working arrangements and competitive salary rates with annual incremental increases.
 We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive workplace for our people and our community. We encourage people of all genders, races, ages and abilities to apply for roles within our Health Service.
 You can find out more about why it's so great to work at Metro North here: https://metronorth.health.qld.gov.au/careers

At Canva, we’re transforming the way the world designs by building a suite of easy-to-use design tools (for graphics, animation, video, and print) in over 100 languages, and across browser-based and mobile platforms. 
 
 
 Since launch in April 2013, we have grown exponentially, amassing over 20 million active users. We are one of the fastest-growing technology companies in the world, with software engineering being a core part of who we are. With a recent valuation of USD $3.2bn and having achieved profitability years ago, we’re building the foundation for the future growth of Canva as we expand our engineering/product development capabilities and global footprint, with new offices set to open in the United States. 
 
 
 In order to ensure we continue to grow and delight our users, we’re hiring a Technical Business Analyst to work with our User Voice group. In this role you will present insights from user feedback to the Product & Engineering teams, and ensure the feedback is acted upon. You are the customer champion, a trusted partner with Product & Engineering teams and an advisor to our Operations teams, helping scale the business through customer feedback. You'll be part analyst, part product manager, and part program manager. 
 What you will do:
 Act as the customer advocate in a rapidly scaling software development environment. 
 Develop strong partnerships with leaders across the business to align strategy and tactics of the products. 
 Ensure that Canva continues to create a flawless experience for customers of our productsDig beyond the data to provide actionable recommendations that help improve the customer and product experience. 
 Build, negotiate, and handle complex initiatives to prevent or eliminate friction in our products. 
 Work together with UX researchers to bring quantitative and qualitative data to together to provide a delightful user experience to our products 
 Required skills:
 Strong experience as a Technical BA in software development, service delivery, or customer support function. 
 Ability to rationalise and communicate business tradeoffs using reliable data, and backed by business acumen 
 Advanced SQL knowledge and Data Analysis experience. 
 Proven program management and product management skills. 
 Excellent written, verbal communication and presentation skills 
 Great attention to detail. 
 Curiosity and desire to share meaningful insights to improve the customer experience. 
 Leadership experience leading a team of business analysts 
 Company Benefits
 Competitive salary, plus equity options 
 Flexible working hours, we value work-life balance 
 In-house chefs that cook delicious breakfast and lunch for us each day 
 Free Yoga membership 
 Generous parental leave policy 
 Pet friendly offices including a garden, climbing wall, unisex toilets 
 Sponsored social clubs and team events 
 Fun and quirky celebrations 
 Relocation budget provided for interstate or overseas candidates

This is a unique opportunity to be a part of a significant Digital Transformation - delivering value to staff, customers and residents alike! 
 
The newly created role of Business Analyst is a permanent assignment to help support the business by understanding and analysing business requirements and documentation in preparation for specific transformational ICT projects. The first major focus will be an end-to-end ERP migration from RFP to completion. 
 
 
About us: 
 
Lutheran Services is a not-for-profit organisation that has been serving the people and communities of Queensland since 1935. We provide quality, contemporary care and support for people of all backgrounds, at more than 20 locations throughout Queensland. 
 
Our dedicated workforce of nearly 1500 makes a difference to the lives of many people every day. They bring our vision to life – helping those we serve to pursue the lives they hope for, and enabling the communities we are part of to thrive. 
 
 
Let’s talk about the role: 
 
This role will lead engagement with multi-functional stakeholders and drive a wide variety of information gathering and process mapping. Working closely with the ICT Program Manager and a Project Manager this role will be required to follow a mix of Waterfall and Agile methodology in managing a variety of projects from requirements to implementation. 
 
In addition, you will; 
 
 Conduct analysis of existing systems, applications and functions to ensure strategic alignment. 
 Conduct extensive consultation work with various stakeholders to determine business requirements and processes across a variety of systems and divisions. 
 Utilise information gathered to advise the business on appropriate solutions and drive specific outcomes to meet stakeholder needs. 
 Utilise the unique opportunity a business analyst has to influence stakeholder buy-in to organisation-wide strategic objectives and increase understanding of how the suggested ICT solutions will help achieve the objectives. 
 Verify successful implementation through testing of project results. 
 Apply industry standards, frameworks and methodologies to drive increased maturity in ICT investments. 
 Mentor and coach the ICT team and business stakeholders on the role of the project and Business Analyst. 
 
 
Now let’s talk about you: 
 
Critical to your success in this role will be the ability to demonstrate: 
 
 You have obtained a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Management or equivalent work experience in this field. Extensive experience as a Business Analyst, 
 Significant experience with ERP systems, and ideally ERP migration projects from beginning to end. 
 Extensive experience with process and information mapping. 
 Experience in Waterfall and Agile project execution experience is a must. 
 Strong verbal and written communication skills, as well as an ability to communicate technical information simply to end users. 
 Experience with data analysis and modelling will be beneficial. 
 Demonstrated experience providing strong stakeholder engagement across a geographically dispersed business. 
 In-depth knowledge of the Aged Care industry with multiple business functions will be beneficial. 
 Able to maintain a National Police Check for Vulnerable Individuals and any other that may be required for our services. 
 Current Queensland driver’s license. 
 
 
What we can offer you: 
 
You will receive: 
 
 Learning and development opportunities 
 Access to salary packaging. 
 Good work life balance. 
 Access to discounts, such as health insurance, holiday and travel, gym membership, IT and home appliances. 
 Membership to our dedicated Employee Assistance Program. 
 
 To apply for the role, please attach your resume, complete the application form and the questions below. To download a copy of the position description, please click  here.

Strong exposure to JD Edwards (Finance, also some Distribution, Sales, Manufacturing) – permanent opportunity based in Sydney.

Knowledge across an array of industries such as telecommunications, retail, finance and health are highly desirable. To be shortlisted for our requirements you must suit the above criteria and have strong project experience, stakeholder management and excellent communication skills.

job_title: Business Analyst - Data - Tax Automation -(2 year Maximum Term Contract)
description:
In this challenging and varied role, you will help us deliver on a significant book of transformation work that is critical to tax. 
 
This is a unique opportunity for you to design and implement market leading data capabilities that will enable the data-driven transformation of our Global direct tax reporting and transfer pricing function. This tax transformation project is global in nature but being run centrally from Sydney. Practical experience and knowledge of tax concepts along with strong data analysis skills are requirements to be successful in this role. 
 
Your focus will be to support the Head of the Tax Reporting Data and Transformation team across multiple change initiatives for the global direct tax reporting function. You will document and process map data and critical controls for tax across a wide range of source systems. Further, you will assess and adopt technology solutions to streamline and automate tax processes, including requirements documentation and analysis of solutions. 
 
In this role you will contribute to the development and maintenance of the transformation requirements backlog, participate in design workshops, testing and the overarching rollout of automation solutions. 
 
 
Key to your success will be your experience in a finance or tax function coupled with excellent process mapping skills. Your practical knowledge in working with data for use in reporting systems, software, spreadsheets, graphs and flow charts along with exposure to tools like Alteryx /or PowerBI will be second to none. You will have the ability to work well under pressure and have strong analytical and problem-solving skills. 
 
If you are motivated by the opportunity to work in a high performing team in a fast-paced environment, we would like to hear from you 
 
 
 About Macquarie 
 The best investment you can make is in yourself. 
 Whether you’re looking to take on a new project; progress within your division; explore an opportunity in a different team; or relocate globally – we let our people decide which direction they want to take.
 At Macquarie we uncover the opportunities others may miss. Our culture promotes innovation, balanced with robust risk management, to realise opportunity for our clients, community, shareholders and our people.
 Macquarie is a diversified global financial group providing clients with asset management, banking, advisory and risk and capital solutions across debt, equity and commodities. Headquartered in Sydney and with offices in 31 markets, it is the breadth of our operations, combined with a strong capital position and risk management framework, that has contributed to our 50-year record of unbroken profitability. 
 
 Job no:  FMG-949571 
 Work type:  Maximum term 
 Location:  Sydney 
 Category:  Accounting & Finance, Data & Analytics, Projects, Improvements & Change 
 Group:  Financial Management Group 
 Division:  Taxation 
 Recruiter:  Julie Collins

Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients. 
POSITION SUMMARY/OVERALL PURPOSE OF THE JOB 
This is an opportunity to take a leading role in the growth of Funds Services within Citi Melbourne. The individual will be responsible for working with business, technology and operations teams to gather analyse and document requirements for implementation of new processes & system functionalities. 
The role requires good understanding of fund service operations as the role requires client interaction and the ability to break down business requirements into functional specifications for technology teams. 
Ability to work successfully on multiple projects and different stakeholders at the same time is pivotal for this role. 
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES 
Analyse requirements using interviews, document analysis and requirements workshops. 
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs. 
Effective documentation of business and functional requirements in specified templates 
Process mapping of As Is and To Be business processes clearly showing benefits and potential improvements. 
Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously. 
Work independently with users to define concepts and under direction of project managers. 
Drive and challenge business units on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plans. 
Strong project management skills to ensure timely and controlled execution of changes 
Stakeholder (external & internal) expectation management and proactive escalation / reporting of issues that could impact project timelines or objectives 
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts. 
Serves as the conduit between the customer community (internal and external customers) and the software development team through which requirements flow. 
Be the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams. 
 
COMPLIANCE RESPONSIBILITIES
 Understand risk & control requirements in Citi and ensure changes are implemented in accordance with the same. 
Ensure the business unit maintains the ethical standards contained in the Code of Conduct. 
Adhere to firm policies and procedures, regulatory and legislative requirement. 
KEY COMPETENCIES / SKILLS 
Technical/Specialist skills/competencies
 Business analysis skills including proactive identification of process improvement opportunities. 
Good knowledge of Project Management concepts and ability to keep stakeholders accountable for respective project deliverables 
Advanced knowledge of fund administration (Fund Accounting and Transfer Agency) 
Ability to meet deliverables accurately and on time. 
Proficient in the use of MS Office tools including Project Plan and Visio 
Good understanding databases (e.g. Oracle), file transfer procedures etc. 
Business/Industry knowledge/competencies
 Knowledge of financial services industry 
Understanding of different financial instruments / investment options 
Understanding of global financial markets. 
Significant industry experience within Financial Markets (particularly Fund Accounting), a varied knowledge would be preferable. 
Personal Attributes/Interpersonal skills 
A good level of decision-making is required. 
Very good interpersonal skills. 
Good organisational and prioritisation skills. 
Self-motivated and hard working. 
Ability to handle work pressure. 
Excellent communication skills (oral & written). 
QUALIFICATIONS / EXPERIENCE REQUIRED 
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Technology or Business Studies. 
Business analysis or Project Management certification would be an advantage 
5+ years of business analysis experience 
2+ years of change/project management experience 
2+ years in Fund accounting processes or projects 
When you work at Citi, you will be working for an organisation that truly has a global footprint and a powerful network that spans the globe. We celebrate individual ingenuity and use the diversity of our people in order to drive high performance. Through dedicated support, training and resources, we promote our talent and future leaders to bring about lasting and positive impact. Citi Australia is an Employer of Choice for Women and supports a flexible work environment.

job_title: Senior Business Analyst - Front Office - Transformation
description:
AMP Capital is a specialist investment manager with offices in Australia, New Zealand, Japan, China, Hong Kong, India, London, Chicago, New York, California, Ireland and the Middle East. We are a leading global real estate and infrastructure manager and the combination of our scale, breadth and capability provides access to superior investment opportunities for our clients. 
 
Our asset class specialists, investment strategists and economists work together with the aim of delivering strong investment outcomes for clients. That is why our clients trust us to invest over AS$200 billion AUM (as at 30 June 2019) on their behalf, across a range of single sector and diversified funds. 
 
The role: 
 
The Public Markets transformation team have been working to identify and chart the future state Target Operating Model for the business in order to support the growth of the company whilst also addressing current operating risks. The aim is to drive standardisation and simplicity within the operating model, mitigate risk, improve efficiency and add value which will result in the creation of a multi-year transformation road map. 
 
Key responsibilities include: 
 
 Engage with front office Portfolio Managers to understand and document requirements and processes for a Portfolio Management System (PMS) 
 Engage with middle office staff to understand and document requirements and processes for a Portfolio Management System (PMS) and Order Management System (OMS) 
 Engage is a PMS/OMS selection process providing insight and knowledge input the analysis and scoring of systems 
 Identify & documents business issues and gaps in system functionality against business requirements 
 Challenge existing business processes and requirements utilising analysis skills and critical thinking, engaging with stakeholders to influence outcomes that provide an improved operating environment 
 Solve complex problems across the front and middle office domains as part of solution design 
 Facilitate development, training, internal communications, deployment and support activities associated with any process improvement or system implementation in the later part of the program 
 
 
Experience Required: 
 
 Experience in dealing with a wide cross section of stakeholders with a key focus on front office Portfolio Managers and middle office dealing desks 
 Strong experience with front and middle office systems (Aladdin, Charles River, Bloomberg, etc) 
 Experience in analysing and resolving business problems with SMEs and key stakeholders 
 Solution based approach – finds issues but offers solutions 
 Analytical mind who is comfortable querying data, challenging status quo, understanding complex environments, and providing business solutions across technology and processes 
 Demonstrated Financial Services experience -  10+  years’ (e.g. Front Office, Middle Office, Custody outsourcing, Back office, Fund Accounting, Unit pricing, Product etc) 
 Excellent written and communication skills 
 Experience in a range of Investment Managers

Reference: 161838 
 
 2 year fixed term contract, salary range $90k - $100k pa + benefits + 9.5% super 
 
Own the relationship with users ensuring scoping and delivery of BI initiatives 
 
 Strong Business Analysis skills to enable a data driven organisation 
 
About the facility 
 
Information Services is a directorate reporting directly to the CEO. We provide services in traditional ICT (servers, storage, networks, security etc.), Clinical Applications management, administration and support, Medical Records, Project Management, Business Intelligence/Data Warehousing and Data Integrity, and run programs to support regional collaboration such as Telehealth. We work closely with our business and clinical colleagues in partnership to deliver innovative and sustainable solutions. 
 
About the role 
 
As the Technical Business Intelligence Analyst you will be responsible for providing Barwon Health with analysis and development of Business Intelligence capabilities within the organisation. This will include providing data insights for the organisation, building analytical repots and real-time dashboards. You enable and drive the use of information to make informed decisions across the organisation with a focus on supporting self-service initiatives. The role is based at University Hospital, Geelong in a modern working environment including flexible working arrangements. 
 
About the culture 
 
Information Services is a dynamic vibrant environment in which to work - our only constant is change. Providing high-quality Information Services that underpin our clinical systems is our shared passion. We are a happy, friendly team and always striving to improve our service delivery. 
 
We are a team that embraces change and are always looking for innovative ideas to improve our team and the organisation.

At Barwon Health we harness a diverse and inclusive workforce where we value each person’s uniqueness. Our organisation promotes the safety, wellbeing and inclusion of our staff and consumers including children, and have appropriate recruitment resources in place to ensure background checks and reference checks are completed.

 Job Description 
 Your Employer 
Is a dynamic organisation committed to providing outstanding service to the local community. Dedicated to a positive culture that cares about its people and their safety, they are future focused and strive to make a real difference. 
The Role 
As Business Solutions Analyst, you will work closely with the ICT team leaders, project managers and a range of key stakeholders to maintain and advance core business systems and processes. 
The role is responsible for collecting and defining customer requirements, incident investigation in corporate systems, planned upgrades, improvements and integrations to ensure the successful delivery of key business solutions and operational improvements. 
Your duties will include (but not be limited to): 
Effectively and efficiently capture, analyse and document business and functional requirements through various approaches and techniques, including workshops and interviews 
Providing consultancy services to assist with understanding the impact of emerging technologies 
Maintaining positive and proactive relationships with customers to understand business area priorities, plans, capabilities and needs 
Undertaking research and reviews of relevant material to provide both contextual and specific insights for a given project or initiative 
Identifying opportunities to align stakeholder requirements where common goals are evident from different business units 
Developing support design documentation such as Use Cases, Problem Statements, functional requirements, technical descriptions, business process mapping, and test scripts 
Undertaking change management activities including communication, knowledge transfer, training, help guides, support 
Leading and assisting technical evaluations of solutions including architectural assessments and tender activities 
Investigating, resolving or completing service incidents, requests, problems and changes and ensure service levels are maintained. 
Contributing toward the development of strategy, architecture alignment, adherence to standards, processes improvement and a Customer Excellence culture 
Identifying industry trends and maintain in-depth knowledge of application technologies and methodologies that are applicable to our industry 
Your Skills & Experience
 The ideal candidate will have a relevant qualification in computer science, information technology/systems or equivalent, proven experience in a similar role. 
You'll come to us demonstrating your skill in working within an agile environment and be equipped with at least five years' relevant technical/systems knowledge and a great track record in service delivery. 
You will have excellent communication skills with the ability to work with a range of stakeholders and be well informed on supporting software in large multidisciplinary organisations. 
To be successful in the role it's important you can address the following criteria: 
Qualifications in IT/computer science/related field or proven experience 
Minimum five years' of working in a similar/agile environment 
Contemporary digital technologies 
Excellent high level communication and stakeholder management skills 
Business process improvement abilities 
Outcome driven, self-managed with a high degree of initiative 
Solid MS Excel, Visio, data analysis and SQL skills 
Proven change management abilities 
Ability to drive and lead a range of HR initiatives and strategic activities 
Prince 2, ITILv3 and local government experience all highly regarded 
Choose Agri Labour Australia 
Agri Labour Australia is an award-winning Australian company with clients in every State and Territory. Proudly representing major agribusiness, large primary producers, rural operators and local farmers - we are more than a recruitment agency. Founded on our firsthand knowledge of the land and dedicated to the ongoing success of our client's businesses and candidate's careers, you can rely on us for expertise, advice and support. 
For a confidential discussion, please contact  Mitchell Merritt , Principal Consultant, Agri Labour Australia:  0 427 715 619

Be inspired everyday 
At HESTA we’re a leading national superannuation fund dedicated to people working in health and community services – a growing sector of ordinary people doing extraordinary things, day in day out, right across Australia. 
 
 More than 860,000 Australians trust HESTA with their money. So together, we invest $55 billion of savings globally. We're about creating brighter futures for our members. And, a better world for generations to come. Our focus is on helping our members enjoy a retirement they’ve worked hard for. 
 
 The opportunity 
We have a number of initiatives that are part of a transformation in our Investments team. We are introducing new systems, new processes and new people. This is an amazing opportunity to join a major investment team from the beginning. We are recruiting 18 month fixed term positions. 
 
 You will lead requirements gathering and analysis activity with key stakeholders, facilitate requirements workshops and work on system design, procurement, build, configuration and implementation phases. Most of all, it is important that you are outstanding at documenting business requirements and creating the necessary project artefacts. You need to be very comfortable in gathering the necessary information from our Investment Team and making sure that information has been captured accurately. 
 
 You have worked in financial services before, particularly with investment fund managers. If you have worked on the system implementation of a target operating model, even better. It isn’t essential, but would be very beneficial, if you have ever worked with Portfolio Management Systems, Order Management systems, performance reporting, reconciliation, Market Data, IBOR or Golden Source. Experience with Bloomberg, FactSet, IRESS, Charles River, SimCorp would be highly regarded. 
 
 In return, you will be embedded in the Investment Team where you will be involved in the decision-making process. You will get superannuation fund experience with a growing industry fund that has a welcoming and supportive culture and great conditions. This is your chance to contribute to a number of critical projects, from start to finish, and gain career building experience and exposure to an expanding industry. Once you have completed probation, we also invest in your development by giving you a training budget and eight days off for you to attend approved courses and events. 
 
 What’s in it for you? 
 Access to great benefits including a competitive remuneration package An inclusive can-do culture Opportunities to learn and grow your career Sustainable and collaborative work spaces 
 
 HESTA is a great place to work but don’t take our word for it, we were named (again!) Employer of Choice for Gender Equality 2018. Go to hesta.com.au/careers to get the position description and more information.

job_title: Asia Pacific Senior Business Analyst (12 months contract)
description:
As the Asia Pacific Growth Analyst, your role is to accelerate best sales business practices and maximize market opportunities to drive corporate strategies and sales success. This will include partnering with the sales teams to define, land and execute against our strategic priorities as well as identifying incremental opportunities for growth through analysis and insight. This role will be involved in everything from defining local market strategies and programs through to the day- to-day execution of the business.
 Key Responsibilities:
 Proactively partner with the Consumer and SMB Sales Leadership in the day-to-day running of the business.
 Identify growth opportunities and develop action plans to improve performance.
 Provide insights through detailed revenue and product analysis.
 Prepare business cases for investments to support growth initiatives.
 Assess current business practices and provide innovative approaches for improved efficiency and effectiveness.
 Support weekly, monthly, and quarterly forecast process, including pipeline analysis, data validation, and identify gaps and actions required.
 Drive the sales quota setting process.
 Requirements:
 5+ years of work experience in sales operations or related field.
 Exceptional Excel skills are a must as is a solid working knowledge with either Tableau or Power BI environments (SQL skills are an advantage but not a requirement).
 Strong problem-solving skills, analytical capabilities and collaboration skills.
 Excellent verbal, written communication skills, ability to present complex ideas to diverse audiences
 Ability to deal with ambiguity in international environments
 Experience in direct and indirect sales structures and strategies in a matrixed organisation
 Exceptional attention to detail, a commitment to quality and be results driven and customer focused.
 "Can do / Will do" attitude in supporting the business.
 At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists . You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.
 If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.
 Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age , sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

About us: 
 
A leading aged care provider, BlueCross offers a wide range of flexible and responsive aged and community care services across metropolitan and regional Victoria since 1993. 
 
We believe our people are our greatest asset – they engage with our clients, day in, day out, to ensure a superior level of care for everyone, including residential care, Home Care, Respite Care and other support services. 
 
We currently operate 34 aged care residences in Victoria, supporting more than 2600 residents and over 1000 clients living in their own homes. BlueCross is proudly supported by over 4000 dedicated employees and hundreds of volunteers. 
 
About the Role: 
 
 
We currently have a fantastic opportunity for a highly motivated and experienced Business Analyst to join our team. 
 
Reporting to Finance Business Partner, this role is primarily responsible for the provision of timely and accurate financial and non-financial management reporting, development of the annual budget, financial analysis and monthly variance analysis, and ad hoc projects related work. With an initial focus on our HomeCare business, the role will transition to support Aged Care. 
 
Your duties will include but are not limited to: 
 
 Preparation of month end and year end processing ensuring accurate and timely preparation of financial data. 
 Analysis and interpretation of results including trend analysis and commentaries clearly explaining key performance drivers and insight into monthly and year to date results. 
 Prepare and distribute management reports including commentary on key trends and variances. 
 Assistance with ownership of all balance sheet balances and initiate correction of any discrepancies 
 Assist with the preparation of annual budgets and forecasts for BlueCross Group within the defined timelines and requirements 
 Business Partnering with Operations to assist them understand the results for the month and ensuring that financial and operational targets are met. 
 Provide financial analysis, information and support the business units and finance team as requested and appropriate. 
 Assist with the Financial Modelling for new business opportunities and/or government contracts 
 Produce ad hoc reports and other analysis and special projects as requested and appropriate. 
 
 About you: 
 
To be successful in the role: 
 
 Must have experience gained within Homecare preferebly or Aged/Healthcare 
 Completion or near completion of a CA or CPA 
 Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel 
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
 Solid organisational skills including the ability to manage conflicting priorities and high work volume 
 High attention to detail and accuracy and is committed to excellence 
 
 Why join BlueCross? 
 
 We are a values driven organisation that recognises our biggest asset is our people 
 We have an amazing (and free !) rewards program which gives you access to salary packaging on some work related expenses, retail and entertainment discounts and much more ! 
 Fantastic learning & development opportunities including paid training and ongoing professional development 
 Great employee benefits including super salary sacrificing and 30% staff discounts on many Australian retail brands 
 Our reward and recognition program that is embedded into our daily culture and work practices 
 Be a part of a leading aged care provider committed to treating our elderly citizens with dignity and respect 
 
 
BlueCross provides exceptional person-centred care and services to our culturally, linguistically and socially diverse consumers. BlueCross is committed to embracing diversity in our teams and ensuring our workplace is culturally safe, inclusive and equitable. 
 
We pride ourselves on providing a workplace for all staff, contractors and associates which is free of discrimination. 
 
Please visit our careers page on www.bluecross.com.au for more information on your career pathway with us. For more information about the position, please visit the position description for this role. 
 
If you are passionate about this opportunity and would like to become part of our BlueCross –  APPLY NOW.

job_title: Business Analyst, Regulatory Reporting - 12 months contract
description:
A great opportunity exists for a proactive and experienced Business Analyst to join the Regulatory Operations team on a 12 month maximum term contract. With a focus on Transaction Reporting in this role you will have the opportunity to add value while working on regulatory assurance and data management programs during a busy period of change. 
 
The Regulatory Operations Team based in Sydney is responsible for the on-going management of global transactions across all businesses which are reportable to key regulatory bodies. You will work closely with Business, Compliance and Operations teams to document regulatory requirements and interpretations. You will be performing root cause investigation, impact analysis, identification and mitigation of issues or risks as well as providing input to test planning for technology teams and execute sample testing. Working closely with the assurance team on the rollout of completeness and accuracy processes, you will assist in the documentation and assessment of existing controls to identify areas of high risk and will gain exposure to derivative products and lifecycle events. 
 
Ideally, you will have a proven track record of working in financial services sector in a similar role and have experience in APAC and US Regulatory OTC Transaction Reporting. You are someone who possesses strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a risk mindset and has the ability to work individually and as part of the team, providing support and guidance to fellow team members. Your excellent stakeholder management, communication and influencing skills coupled with your ability to adapt in constant change will see you thrive in this role. 
 
This is a unique opportunity for an experienced Business Analyst who is looking for new challenge and to gain exposure to various stakeholders and work across the end to end transaction reporting lifecycle. 
 
If you are looking for a new challenge and if this sounds like you, please . 
 
The Corporate Operations Group brings together specialist support services in Digital Transformation & Data, Technology, Market Operations, Human Resources, Business Services, Business Improvement & Strategy, and the Macquarie Group Foundation. The Corporate Operations Group’s purpose is to power the entrepreneurial enterprise. 
 
 
Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team. 
 
We facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams. Talk to us about what flexibility may be available. 
 
 
 About Macquarie 
 The best investment you can make is in yourself. 
 Whether you’re looking to take on a new project; progress within your division; explore an opportunity in a different team; or relocate globally – we let our people decide which direction they want to take.
 At Macquarie we uncover the opportunities others may miss. Our culture promotes innovation, balanced with robust risk management, to realise opportunity for our clients, community, shareholders and our people.
 Macquarie is a diversified global financial group providing clients with asset management, banking, advisory and risk and capital solutions across debt, equity and commodities. Headquartered in Sydney and with offices in 31 markets, it is the breadth of our operations, combined with a strong capital position and risk management framework, that has contributed to our 50-year record of unbroken profitability.

We are looking for an experienced business analyst with ERP understanding in Logistics, Order processing, Purchasing and Accounting to work in a small team implementing and developing customer's Priority erp systems.
 Job Description 
 You will be required to work in conjunction with the clients at senior and shop floor level, documenting and understanding requirements and developing solutions. Tasks will include ERP Consulting, implementation and development, telephone and onsite support to customers. Monitoring and managing service calls. Web application development directly configured to the Priority ERP system. Priority ERP consulting and development using the built in tool set.
 
Some experience / exposure to Priority ERP software and its application are essential. Training will be given in the use of development tools etc but you will already know Priority's basics.
 There is potential for interstate and overseas travel
 
 Key Requirements 
 
The applicant will have an understanding of the use of computer systems in business, business knowledge, an understanding of accounting principles. He/she will be capable of SIMPLE web developments using HTML5, JavaScript, JSON, ODATA, REST API's. The candidate must possess a willingness to learn, have a "do whatever it takes" attitude to customer support and an ability to work unsupervised. There must be a desire to be the best consultant available to the customer. It's important to have a sense of humour but also a sense of duty.
 
The candidate must be willing to produce practical solutions rather than technically brilliant programming. Simplicity being the key.
 
 Required Computer Skills 
 Business applications knowledge.
 Priority ERP functionality and navigation
 Principles of SQL SERVER
 SQL programming (Desirable)
 Database understanding
 Javascript / HTML / C# / CSS- Web Development ability would be beneficial.
 Microsoft Office Products.
 Additional Comments 
 This job requires significant business skills, problem solving skills, communication skills, technical application and functional practicality. Technical knowledge is important!
 Current driving license and own transport are essential as you will be expected to visit clients.
 Excellent spoken and written English communication is essential as customer interaction will be required
 Send your current CV to Carol Ray: carolr@priorityerp.com 
 
 Priority ERP is an equal opportunity employer & prohibits discrimination & harassment of any kind: Priority ERP is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, colour,religion or belief, national,social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, sexual orientation,partnership status or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.Priority ERP will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Priority ERP encourages applicants of all ages.

Primary Responsibilities:
  Determine operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats
  Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions
  Leading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies
  Use data modeling practices to analyze your findings and create suggestions for strategic and operational improvements and changes
  Designs new computer programs by analyzing requirements; constructing workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications
  Conducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings
  Consider the opportunities and potential risks attached to the suggestions you have made
  Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management
  Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports
  Defines project requirements by identifying project milestones, managing projects, developing project plans, and monitoring performance by establishing project budget
  Monitors project progress by tracking activity, resolving problems, publishing progress reports, recommending actions
  Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements
  Produce written documentation to support your work, report on your findings and to present to stakeholders when necessary
  Participates in Integration Testing and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Functionality Testing
  Managing competing resources and priorities
  Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects
 Qualification:
  3-5 years of experience in Business analytics, exploratory analysis, unstructured analysis, and creating analytics datasets
  Should be open to learn quickly on new technologies like ASP.NET, AJAX, SQL Server, SharePoint development and web development
  Proficient in SQL Server, SAS, Tableau and basic to intermediate skills in Amazon Web Services
  Ability to design and develop advanced SQL or PL/SQL stored procedures using RDBMS concepts

A shared passion for our people. 
 Our people can be proud that, as a leading international agri-business, we provide an increasingly important service across the food and beverage supply chain. 
 
About our team 
 GrainCorp connects more than 10,000 grain growers with local and international customers via Australia’s largest silo network, with a storage capacity of over 20 million tonnes, seven bulk port elevators and two specialty port terminals. Innovation, integration and partnership are the foundations on which we are growing into our second century with customers at the heart of all that we do. 
 You will join a team of 6 that provide application support, continuous improvement and deliver upgrades/projects to maintain SAP business applications & associated solutions. As part of the team, you will continuously improve and drive consistent practices, processes, procedures, governance and standards to ensure applications support consistency across the business. 
 
About the role 
 We are seeking a talented Senior Business Analyst - Digital to work closely with Business Units to effectively translate business needs into solutions; thereby contributing to the alignment of the IT strategy with business initiatives and projects. You will have an appreciation of both IT and business strategies and be able to champion key recommendations through the approval process to allow for implementation. 
 Other key responsibilities of this role include; 
 Developing acceptance criteria and functional specifications that design and document the desired outcome of system enhancements/developments 
 Analyse and deliver business process analysis initiatives by either managing some components of large initiatives or all components of medium sized initiatives 
 Foster and build key relationships with Product Owners, Business Process Owners and Subject Matter Experts 
 Work with product/project teams of developers, test analysts, UX/UI designers, BAs and architects 
 Help co-ordinate training, user acceptance and product showcases of solutions 
 About your experience 
 To be successful in this role you will be a self-starter who is motivated to deliver quality outcomes to internal stakeholders whilst acting with a high degree of initiative and ownership. It goes without saying that excellent written and verbal communication while sound planning and prioritisation skills will be critical to your success in addition to; 
 Solid previous IT BA experience working on Digital projects (customer-facing websites and mobile apps) 
 Experience in working in both Waterfall and Agile environments (specifically Scrum and its associated ceremonies) 
 Experience working in a complex technical environment (preferably integrating front-end solutions into a SAP ERP system) 
 Strong ability to converse with and present to both end-users and IT employees at all levels of the organisation, including written and verbal comms 
 Ability to run efficient and valuable meetings/workshops 
 Tertiary qualified in an Analytical Discipline or equivalent experience 
 Outstanding specification writing and documentation skills 
 Excellent ability to analyse, isolate and interpret business needs and propose appropriate solutions 
 Ability to take a broad view of many applications and business processes 
 Proven analytical ability and demonstrated high numeracy skills 
 High level of accuracy and able to work under pressure 
 Do you share our passion for contributing to the success of a diverse, international team? 
 At GrainCorp, we value and respect the different perspectives and experiences our people bring to work each day. We aim to increase the diversity of our workforce – leading to a range of different thinking, perspectives and ideas that create the innovation we need to drive better business results. We aim to have a work environment where everyone feels included and everyone can realise their full potential.

ICT Business Analyst United Petroleum Hawthorn, Melbourne United Petroleum is reinvigorating and re-conceptualizing its retail offering during an exciting period of sustained business growth. The purpose of the ICT Business Analyst position is to provide business critical insight into the data captured from both our convenience and fuel businesses. The ICT Business Analyst will be required to provide expert analysis of our existing data reporting systems and will subsequently enact measures to transform the quality of the data presented to company executives. United Petroleum is Australia's fastest-growing independent petrol and convenience company. We offer premium quality fuels and specialize in retail and wholesale fuel markets, convenience stores, fuel importation, fuel distribution and ethanol manufacturing. United Petroleum are 100 per cent Australian-owned and with 400+ service stations and unmanned locations nationally, we are dynamic and fast-paced with very exciting growth plans in place. Duties of the role:  Analysis of financial/inventory data to help efficiently implement a complex system and software transformation project for United Petroleum’s retail store sales; Regular monitoring of data/reports with preparation of data to be used as inputs to KPIs. This may, in turn, require training support to sites and liaison with area and state managers; Analysis of financial data to assist in logistics improvements in systems and software to seek to prevent company losses; Coordinating project activities whilst ensuring the delivery of tasks to tight deadlines; Timely reporting on project activities and deliverables as required; Liaison with IT, stakeholders and internal/external customers regarding solutions; and Provide constructive suggestions for process optimization. About the candidate:  Hold at least a Bachelor level qualification; At least two years of relevant work experience - preferably oil and gas or FMCG experience with prior knowledge of retail POS systems / payment systems; Strong data analysis skills with capacity to link disparate data sources to derive business solutions; Visio, SQL, Powerpoint, Word, Outlook, Jira, process mapping skills; Advanced Excel skills; The ability to use initiative, identify areas of opportunity and actively promote such ideas for the benefit of the company. Prior training experience working with individuals / small groups; Ability to work independently with minimal supervision; Capacity to learn quickly and apply that knowledge; Developed problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail; and Salary range: $80,000 - $90,000 base salary per annum, excluding super. Dates advertised: 18-03-2020 to 15-04-2020 Please direct all applications through this website. Job Types: Full-time, Permanent Salary: $80,000.00 to $90,000.00 /year Experience: business analyst: 2 years (Required) Work Eligibility: No work eligibility is required, I am willing to sponsor the right candidate (e.g. visa) (Preferred)

The Macquarie Capital business is investing in an exciting digital transformation that will transition all underlying core business technology from in-house systems to industry leading software-as-a-service solutions with a focus on Salesforce as a key pillar. 
This newly created Business Systems Analyst role will be report to the Product Owner for Transaction Management and focused on seeking out, developing and thoroughly defining systems requirements that drive improved efficiency and digitalisation across the entire deal lifecycle. Your day-to-day focus will be to support the Product Owner in analysing the business domain while stocking and grooming the product backlog with the Technology Delivery Team. 
Ideally, you will be a detailed planner and expert communicator who is wholly committed to the discovery and development of robust solutions in an ever-changing digital landscape. 
To be successful, you will need: 
5+ years of proven experience in product requirements analysis and definition 
proven experience working in Agile and Waterfall delivery methodologies 
exceptional analytical abilities, attention to detail and ability to learn new concepts quickly 
practical experience generating process documentation and reports 
excellent communicator with the ability to translate technical details into actionable insights 
proven capabilities in project and user-testing management 
highly proficient technical writing capabilities 
exposure to Salesforce and Investment Banking will be of significant benefit. 
To start your journey with us and work on this exciting digital transformation, apply online today. 
About Macquarie Capital 
Macquarie Capital offers global capability in M&A Advisory, Debt and Equity Capital Markets and Principal Investments underpinned by deep specialist expertise across a range of sectors. Our people are empowered to think innovatively to address client challenges and originate opportunities, thinking beyond individual transactions to become a trusted adviser and partner over the long haul. From origination to execution, our unique combination of ideas, capital and expertise is transforming opportunity into reality for our clients and partners around the world. 
With staff in 29 offices transacting across 19 countries, Macquarie Capital is a truly global business. A role in the team will expose you to a dynamic working environment and the opportunity to contribute to high-profile transactions whilst working in a business with the best people in the industry. 
Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion 
Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

We are seeking a talented  Technical Business Analyst  with strong analytical skills to join our team. This role is a great opportunity to lead change and help lead the way to enhance our tax automation capabilities through technology. 
 
In this role, you will be responsible for strategic design and mapping of Macquarie’s Tax Reporting business requirements and solutions to system/technical requirements. You will help us deliver on a significant book of transformation work that is critical to tax. In addition, you will write technical specifications (for custom development, system integration, etc.) based on interactions directly with the Tax Reporting Team and Central Architecture team. 
 
You will: 
 
 support the Tax Reporting Data and Transformation team across multiple change initiatives for the global tax reporting function. 
 document and process map data and critical controls for Indirect and Direct tax across a wide range of source systems. 
 oversee and be accountable for the successful completion of all aspects of assigned project work 
 assess and adopt technology solutions to streamline and automate tax processes, including requirements documentation and analysis of solutions. 
 
 About you: 
 
 end to end project experience in a finance or tax function would be preferred 
 experience in business process flow analysis, requirements gathering and detailed functional design 
 good understanding of at least one programming language (C#, Java) 
 ability to assimilate and apply new concepts, business models and technologies.
